Job Description: Job Description•	To supervise and guide credit officer who are under their assigned areas•	To execute promotional and merchandising activities•	To plan and implement on premise promotion through the sale representative•	To generate daily, weekly and monthly sales reports•	Manage customer relationship to maintain and generate new sales•	Visit/meet with clients to make new sales•	Meet and exceed sales targets set by the Company•	Conduct regular market and dealer visits and provincial missions•	To perform other related tasks as needed
Job Requirement: Requirements•	University degree in sale/marketing or related field•	Good communication of English, written and spoken•	At least 2 years’ experience in leadership position•	Good communication and interpersonal skills•	Able to work under pressure and long hours when needed•	Positive attitude and possess knowledge of distribution businessOther BenefitsPhone card, gasoline allowance and sale commission
Company Profile:
Established in 2021, Mango Finance PLC is a digital microfinance startup based in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, capitalized by an investment from Vipar Auto FZCO, Dubai. With direct access to over 100,000 customers, we are capturing the opportunity to lend digitally and securely.

Mango Finance PLC intends to transform the microfinance landscape in Cambodia by leveraging the powers of technology and data. We believe in improving access to capital for the unbanked in Cambodia, with our proprietary credit scoring engine.

Mango Finance PLC is a licensed Microfinance Institution, regulated by the National Bank of Cambodia. Please visit www.mangofinance.net for more information.

job title: ប្រធានក្រុមភ្នាក់ងារលក់ (Area Sale Supervisor)
position: ប្រធានក្រុមភ្នាក់ងារលក់ (Area Sale Supervisor)
Job Description:
•	រាយឈ្មោះតំបន់សំខាន់ៗ ម៉ូយបោះដុំដែលជាការងារចាំបាច់ក្នុងការផ្គត់ផ្គង់ទំនិញដើម្បីសម្រេចបាននូវគោលបំណងរបស់ខ្លួនប្រកប   ដោយជោគជ័យ។ មានពត៌មានច្បាស់លាស់ ចំនួនតូប ចំនួនហាង និង ផលិតផលដែលបានលក់ជូនអតិថិជន បែងចែក និង ចែកចាយផលិតផលអោយបានគ្រប់តូបទៅតាមទិសដៅនិងគោលដៅដែលបានអនុឡោមតាមគោលការណ៏ ចក្ខុវិស័យរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន ។ ធានាអនុវត្តន៏តាម បេសកម្មស្នូល ព្រមទាំងរក្សានូវគុណតំលៃរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន ។ ពិនិត្យមើលផលិតផលដែលបានដាក់បង្ហាញនៅក្នុងហាងត្រូវស្តង់ដាររបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន និងធានាថាមិនមានផុតកំណត់។

•	ធានាឪ្យបានសម្រេចតាមគោលដៅដែលបានគ្រោងទុកនៅក្នុងតារាង KPIs (ទំហំការលក់, សកម្មភាពពាណិជ្ជកម្ម, ការចែកចាយ, ចំនួនតំបន់គ្រប់គ្រង, ការផ្សព្វផ្សាយលក់ទំនិញ...ល)។

•	ទទួលខុសត្រូវប្រតិបត្តិផែនការសកម្មភាពទីផ្សារ ផ្សាព្វផ្សាយ តាំងបង្ហាញ នៅតាមបណ្តាកន្លែងលក់ទិញទំនិញ (ទីផ្សារ) តូច ហាង។ គាំទ្ររដល់ការអភិវឌ្ឍន៍ផែនការសកម្មភាពទីផ្សារ ពាណិជ្ជកម្ម និងប្រតិបត្តិការលក់ទ្រង់ទ្រាយធំដោយផ្តល់ពត៌មានត្រឡប់មកវិញពីការការអនុវត្តិសកម្មភាព។

•	ធានាឪ្យមានការប្រកាន់ខ្ជាប់ទៅនឹងគោលការណ៍ និងលក្ខខ័ណ្ឌច្បាប់របស់ក្រុមហ៊ុននៅក្នុងនោះមាន គោលការណ៍គ្រប់គ្រងលេខ                 កូដកម្មវិធីថែមជូនអតិថិជន កម្មវិធីពិសេស ព្រមទាំង កិច្ចព្រមព្រៀងពាណិជ្ជកម្ម និង បទបញ្ជាផ្ទៃក្នុងក្នុងជាមួយក្រុមហ៊ុន។

•	លើកទឹកចិត្តអតិថិជន ជំរុញ និងអនុវត្តការលក់ផលិតផលជាមួយការគ្រប់អតិថិជនប្រកមដោយតម្លាភាព។

•	អភិវឌ្ឍនិងការថែរក្សាទំនាក់ទំនងជាមួយក្រុមការងារ អតិថិជន ប្រកបដោយប្រសិទ្ធិភាពតាមរយៈការចែករំលែក ចំណេះដឹង និងលើកទឹកចិត្ត ផ្តល់ភាពស្មើភាពក្នុងការងារការទទួលខុសត្រុវ ។ ផ្តល់មតិយោបល់ក្នុងការកែលំអរក្នុងន័យស្ថាបនា ។

•	ធានាឪ្យបានប្រសិទ្ធិភាពខ្ពស់ក្នុងការអនុវត្តការងារនៅក្នុងនោះជារួមមាន ការអនុវត្តន៍លក់តាមផែនការ ស្តង់ដារការលក់ និងតាមវិធីសាស្រ្តផ្សេងៗជាច្រើនទៀត ដែលបានរៀន និង បណ្តុះបណ្តាល។
Job Requirement:
** បទពិសោធន៍ការងារ និងការសិក្សា៖
* កម្រិតសិក្សា
* លម្អិតអំពីកម្រិតនៃការសិក្សា

Job Description:
 Direct and supervise claims activities of all Partnered Branches.
 Conducts necessary investigations, validations and evaluations of claims filed.
 Conducts continuing information dissemination in the area of coverage (Regular visits on the branch covered and regular visit to clients).
 Consult with related parties such as lawyers, physicians, and other experts related to claims when needed.
 Provide claims settlements in accordance with insurance policies.
 Respond to client’s queries related to claims.
 Ensures the maintenance of appropriate recording and filing system of all claims.
 Maintain current, completed, and accurate premium registers and other related underwriting records in the prescribed forms.
 Check the accuracy of monthly report submitted by branches against partner database.
 Performs any other duties as assigned by a manager.
Job Requirement:
 BA in Business or related fields.
 Strong analytical skills.
 Good problem solving and complaint handling skill.
 Good interpersonal and negotiation skills.
 Integrity and hard-working.
 Good command in English.
 Willing to travel to work in the field/provinces.
Company Profile: LOLC (CAMBODIA) PLC. is one of the top licensed microfinance institutions in Cambodia with a social vision and a business orientation that provides entrepreneurs and families at the base of the socio-economic pyramid with economic opportunities to transform the quality of their lives and their communities through the provision of effective and sustainable client-empowering financial services. Currently, LOLC serves more than 234,860 clients with loans outstanding of more than 603 million USD.

Job Description:
 Implement the plans to recruit all levels of suitable talents.
 Assist in designing the job descriptions and job analysis.
 Assist to train, guide, and coach the recruitment team.
 Builds a quality relationship with the internal customers and external recruitment agencies.
 Support in recommending staff promotion, suspension, dismissal, and/or transfer of staff
directly supervised.
 Implements and enforces staff recruitment & selection policies and guidelines.
 Build the branding for the employer of choice.
 Prepare monthly recruitment reports.
 Conduct training needs assessment through training need and job analysis, appraisal schemes
and consultation with staff’s immediate supervisor.
 Assist to develop annual training plan and training budget and ensure that all training activities
are in place with budgeting effectively and efficiency.
 Develop and coordinate all training activities process within Serendib by contacting resource persons, preparing proposal and schedule for approval and acting as a class monitor to make sure that training course is managed effectively and efficiency.
 Assist to produce training reports and monthly employee training record to make sure that all training activities and staff train are regular recorded and filled.
 Build networking with resource person internally and external training companies.
 Other tasks assigned by Head of Finance and Administration Department.
Job Requirement:
 BA in HRM and equivalent.
 Clear grasp and understanding of the National Labor Laws and related Prakas.
 Knowledge and skills in wage and salary administration.
 Minimum of 2 year-experiences in a insurance company or microfinance institution.
 Communication skills (able to speak and write English); excellent team-player.
 People- yet result-oriented.
 Hard-working and able to work under pressure.

Job Description:
កម្មវត្ថុ ៖ សំណើសុំការដាក់ឯកសារដេញថ្លៃក្នុងការផ្គត់ផ្គង់ថេប្លេត(Tablet) និងស្រោមថេប្លេត(Case)។

អង្គការខាណាជាអង្គការមិនមែនរដ្ឋាភិបាលក្នុងស្រុកមួយ ដែលធ្វើការពាក់ព័ន្ធទៅនឹងវិស័យសុខាភិបាល ដោយផ្តោតជាសំខាន់លើការគាំទ្រការបង្ការមេរោគអេដស៍ ការថែ និងទាំគាំទ្រ និងសេវាជំងឺរបេងនៅសហគមន៍។

អង្គការខាណាក៏បានផ្តល់ការអប់រំអំពីសិទ្ធិលើសុខភាពផ្លូវភេទ និងបន្តពូជ​ ផែនការគ្រួសារ សុខភាពមាតា និងទារក និងជំងឺមិនឆ្លងដទៃទៀត។
ដើម្បីឆ្លើយតបទៅនឹងតម្រូវការក្នុងការប្រើប្រាស់ ថេប្លេត(Tablet) និងស្រោមថេប្លេត(Case) អង្គការខាណាកំពុងស្វែងរកក្រុមហ៊ុនចូលរួមដេញថ្លៃក្នុងការផ្តត់ផ្គង់ ថេប្លេត(Tablet) ចំនួន២៧៥គ្រឿង និងស្រោមថេប្លេត(Case) ចំនួន២៧៥ ​ ដើម្បីយកទៅប្រើប្រាស់ក្នុងសហគមន៍នៃតំបន់ដែលអង្គការខាណាបាននឹង​កំពុងអនុវត្តគម្រោង ក្រោមជំនួយថវិកាពីទីភ្នាក់ងារសហរដ្ឋអាមេរិកដើម្បីការអភិវឌ្ឍអន្តរជាតិ (USAID) ក្នុងតម្លៃប្រកួតប្រជែងទៅតាមទីផ្សារ។ ប្រសិនបើក្រុមហ៊ុន លោក លោកស្រី មានចំណាប់អារម្មណ៍ក្នុងការចូលរួមដេញថ្លៃ
Job Requirement:

Job Description:

• Coordinate the team throughout all project management phases.
• Monitor problems that are requested by the client.
• Meet with individual team members to find and fix any issues.
• Coordinate internal resources and third parties for the execution of the project.
• Assign tasks to team members with explanations.
• Review the code of the team members before the merge and upload to the system.
• Monitor progress and make adjustments as needed.
• Delivering training and mentoring to project team members.
• Report and escalate to the CEO as needed.

• Bachelor’s Degree in Information Technology or other relevant fields.
• 3+ years of project management and related experience in purchase order and payment schemes.
• Outstanding leadership, organizational, and time management skills.
• Good knowledge of Linux(Ubuntu server) and AWS.
• Honest, flexible, Hardworking, and good at communication.
• Ability to analyze projects and new features.
• Able to review the code of the developer.
• Ability to solve complex problems in projects under deadlines.
• Good communication in English.
• Able to research and learn new technologies.

- Social Security Fund

Job Description:
 Direct and supervise claims activities of all Partnered Branches.
 Conducts necessary investigations, validations and evaluations of claims filed.
 Conducts continuing information dissemination in the area of coverage (Regular visits on the branch covered and regular visit to clients).
 Consult with related parties such as lawyers, physicians, and other experts related to
claims when needed.
 Provide claims settlements in accordance with insurance policies.
 Respond to client’s queries related to claims.
 Ensures the maintenance of appropriate recording and filing system of all claims.
 Maintain current, completed, and accurate premium registers and other related underwriting records in the prescribed forms.
 Check the accuracy of monthly report submitted by branches against partner database.
 Performs any other duties as assigned by a manager.
Job Requirement:
 BA in Business or related fields.
 Strong analytical skills.
 Good problem solving and complaint handling skill.
 Good interpersonal and negotiation skills.
 Integrity and hard-working.

 ធានាថារថយន្តត្រូវបានសម្អាត និងថែទាំបចេ្ចកទេសបានត្រឹមត្រូវ។
 សហការជាមួយបុគ្គលិកក្នុងផ្នែកផ្សេងៗទៀត ដើម្បីឲ្យធ្វើឲ្យមានទំនាក់ទំនងល្អក្នុងការងារ។
 ជួយការងាររបស់អ្នកបើកបរដទៃទៀត ក្នុងករណីចំបាច់ និងបំពេញការងារផ្សេងៗ។
 ជួយបុគ្គលិករដ្ឋបាល ក្នុងការ​ផ្ញើរឯកសារទៅអតិថិជន អ្នកផ្គត់ផ្គង់ ឬដៃគូរអាជីវកម្ម។
 បំពេញការងារផ្សេងៗទៀតក្រោមការចាត់ចែងរបស់អ្នកគ្រប់គ្រង។
Job Requirement:
 កម្រិតសិក្សាចាប់ពីថ្នាក់ទី១២ឡើងទៅ។
 មានបទពិសោធន៍បើកបរយ៉ាងតិច ២ឆ្នាំ។
 យល់ដឹងពីច្បាប់ចរាចរណ៍ និងបទបញ្ជាផ្សេងៗនៃចរាចរណ៍ផ្លូវគោក​ និង​ចេះដោះស្រាយបញ្ហាព្រមទាំងជួលជុល
រថយន្តពេលដែលខូច ឬក៏មានបញ្ហានៅតាមផ្លូវ។
 អាចទៅធ្វើការនៅតាមខេត្តតាមការចាត់តាំងរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន។
 មានប័ណ្ណបើកបរត្រឹមត្រូវ និងមានសុពលភាព។

job title: Store Supervisor (Jelly Bunny and CCOO Brand-Chip Mong 271)
position: Store Supervisor (Jelly Bunny and CCOO Brand-Chip Mong 271)
Job Description:
PEOPLE MANAGEMENT
• To organise and distribute tasks and positions to each member of the team.
• To communicate actively with the team, according to requirements.
• To ensure a good level of customer service in the team.
• To participate in the recruitment of store personnel and learn to do it on your own.
• To actively collaborate in the correct integration of all new employees
• To detect the potential of each employee and mentor them in their development.
• To support with the effective management of personnel administration duties.
• To monitor and ensure the correct personal and professional image of the team.
• Wherever necessary, to manage potential conflict in the correct manner.
• To ensure compliance with the regulations and the legislation.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT
• To actively participate in planning the required measures in order to meet targets.
• To analyse management indicators and costs in order to improve them.
• To continuously monitor sales and customer service.
• During busy periods, to dedicate time to direct selling alongside the team.
• To supervise and apply administrative procedures according to the internal regulations.
• To apply all instructions received (HQ, supervisor, etc.) and report on them (if necessary).
• To carry out strict supervision of the entire cash desk procedure.
• To participate in the optimisation of internal resources and try to minimise expenses e.g.
optimisation of the workforce, suppliers, etc.
• To communicate and pass on any information that may affect sales.

PRODUCT AND MERCHANDISING
• To be familiar with the collection and maximise sales (initial order, entries, etc.).
• To participate in the implementation of Merchandising standards.
• To know the profitability of the store and furniture displays in order to maximise sales.
• To be familiar with and apply the replenishing standards of the store.
• To respect and monitor compliance with merchandising and furniture display guidelines.
• To produce stylings, silhouettes and combinations on a regular basis.
• To control and manage stock (both in transit and in the stockroom) and inventories.
• To ensure the correct end of season return (inventories).
• To ensure compliance with the store image, maintenance and window dressing standards.
• To provide product feedback (his/hers and customers’).
Job Requirement:
• Basic knowledge of the business indicators.
• Customer Service Standard and Service Policy.
• Knowledge of the collection and awareness of fashion.
• Merchandising Standards.
• Cash register programme and Pathfinder operation.
• Internal regulations and some knowledge of employment legislation.
• Product awareness and commercial orientation.
• Organisation, management and planning.
• Able to analyse and offer solutions.
• A motivator with leadership qualities.
• Communicative and persuasive.
• Customer and image-oriented.
• Ability to adapt – energy and speed.
• Is enthusiastic, friendly, cordial and polite.
• Shows initiative and decision-making/problem-solving ability.
• Acts quickly and is multi-disciplinary.
• Self-motivating and self-critical.
Company Profile:
Since starting out in 1947, Jaspal Group has substantially diversified from import home linen distribution to a highly diversified textile driven conglomerate with interests in manufacturing, trading, retailing and real estate. The Group is known for a range of products from sophisticated to chic
ranging from men & ladies fashion, bags, fashion accessories to lifestyle home fashion and bedding
products for better living.

One of the most successful companies under Jaspal Group is Jaspal Company Limited, the top leading fashion retail company in Thailand engaging in designing, manufacturing, and marketing of several clothing and accessories brands. With over 2,350 professional staff and a network of 350
shops and corners all over Thailand, the Company has also proclaimed its reputation across Asian markets, as well as other major cities in the world.

Jaspal Group has stepped forward to expand its business to Cambodia under the name of Jaspal Fashions (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. and introduced four stores namely Jelly Bunny, Lyn, Lyn Around and CC-OO to AEON Mall, Phnom Penh. We are now ready to take a new challenge to introduce more stores to AEON Mall 2.

In this occasion, we are pleased to invite the qualified candidates who are passionate about fashion to join us and become a part of the greater success.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mr. Chin Panha  N/A kh-hr@jpsfashions.com Chip Mong 271 Mega Mall (Phnom Penh) N/A

Job Description: OpportunityResponsible for all vessel operations, ground operations.Key Responsibilities:Marine & Ground operations- In general, act as focal point to coordinate between various parties (ship, area office, customer service, sales, global service center, partners, terminal, suppliers etc) to ensure a smooth call of Sealand vessel to Cambodia port, and smooth daily ground operations.- Work with relevant parties to create optimal Berthing Plan for ships calling to Cambodia port in the way that ensure vessel can berth as early as possible, shorten port stay and depart as early as possible.- Work with terminal and relevant parties to deliver high berth/work productivity during port stay and monitor the load/discharge process.- Adjust Stowage plan for loading with Chief officer and terminal to ensure a high load/discharge productivity and high schedule reliability, safety.- Arrange and coordinate all vessel husbandry matters to ensure vessel smoothly arrive and depart.- Coordinate with relevant parties for all vessel/container incidents happening at local (twistlock, reefer damage, cargo transfer, vessel damage and etc)- Ensure port memo system correctly updated for Cambodia port.- Ensure all vessel reports are sent by relevant parties in timely manner (TDR, final load list, departure baplie, container damage report, seal mismatch and etc).- Coordinate with all relevant parties to set up new terminal, service call.- Arrange for loading late gate in container, outlist container as per agreement with related parties.- Work with terminal to get favorable proforma window as per request from Sealand HQ.- Work with local authority including Port Authority, Pilot, Police, Custom following instruction from manager.- Coordinate with Finance Business partner and other relevant parties to monitor and protect cost. In daily work, propose the operations solution that is cost optimal for the business.- Coordinate matters related to transportation plan such as cut off time, out of gauge (OOG) acceptance, dangerous goods (DG) acceptance.- Keep track of performance via KPI, take proper action to drive for improvement.- Proactively work with commercial team, Local Product and render support to deliver a good service to customer.- Support L&S volume/GP growth, support internal Intermodal/CHB business.- Continuously find way to improve process, SOP.- Coordinate with relevant parties to resolve any ad-hoc situation.
Job Requirement: - Bachelor’s degree level education in Business or other relevant discipline with 1-3 years’ work experience after graduation, in parallel with education or between degrees. Fresh Graduate is welcomed to apply.- An excellent command of spoken and written English.- Fast learner, team player, flexible in terms of working hours and work allocation assigned by management.- Willingness to work 24/7 in case required.

Company Profile:
A Singapore Brand, A Global Business 

With a corporate history that extends more than a hundred years, Yeo’s (also known as YHS or Yeo Hiap Seng) has grown from strength to strength, from its humble beginnings as a striving enterprise in pre-war Singapore, to its transformation as a food & beverage conglomerate with a global network that spans Asia-Pacific, Europe, North America and Oceanic regions. 

A category leader in the Asian drinks market, Yeo’s has broadened its customer reach and entrenched its industry presence through a combination of geographical expansion and product diversification. On the beverage business front, Yeo’s competitive advantage lies in the Group’s ability to stay true and current to consumers’ changing palettes and individual preferences based on lifestyle and cultural differences. 

With a century of heritage, the Yeo's brand bears the hallmark of superior product quality. Yeos is committed to meeting evolving consumer needs and growing market demands through continued product innovation. 

We are honored to have won following awards in the recent two years: 
2017 Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Most Popular Regional Brand Overall Winner; 
2017 Singapore Prestige Brand Award - Regional Brands; 
2018 The Brand Laureate World Halal Brand Award 2018 - Best Brands in FMCG - Food & Beverage.

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.

Company Profile:
1. VISION:
“A leading Cambodian social microfinance institution working to achieve positive and lasting changes in the livelihoods of economically active poor families in a socially responsible manner”

2. MISSION:
“To improve the livelihoods, skills, and self-confidence of poor families in Cambodia by providing responsible microfinance and complementary socio-economic services”

3. CORE VALUES:
■ INTEGRITY: 
Chamroeun provides financial services and socio-economic services to its clients to enhance their well-being. It achieves this ethically and with transparent, fair, and cost effective methods. This manner is also applied to Chamroeun’s other stakeholders.

■ QUALITY OF SERVICES: 
At Chamroeun, we believe that our clients deserve tailored as well as efficient services. We provide these services in a convenient, proactive, and timely manner.

■ TRANSPARENCY: 
At Chamroeun, we provide our clients and other stakeholders with complete and accurate information about the terms and conditions of our products and services. Information is provided in a user-friendly manner to enable them to easily understand those terms and conditions.

■ FAIR PRACTICES: 
At Chamroeun, we ensure that the services we provide to our clients as well as the interactions we have with other stakeholders are not unethical or deceptive. We are committed to building relationships that are based on respect, fair treatments, and courtesy.

■ CONFIDENTIALITY: 
Privacy of our clients and other stakeholders is strictly safeguarded and stored, and such data is only used upon their consents, and they are well informed on specific purposes of data usage.

■ NON-DISCRIMINATION: 
Chamroeun considers its clients and other stakeholders as value assets and take all of efforts to make sure that the institution treats them in appropriate manner.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR HR Manager 010714813 kholel@chamroeun.com #425, St. 271, Sangkat Toul Tompong II, Khan Chamkarmoan, Phnom Penh, Cambodia 010714813

Job Description: •	Monitor, troubleshoot alarm and performance of bank’s IT infrastructure such as servers, databases, network, and data centers to ensure all services are up/running 24/7;•	Manage and optimize monitoring system to keep critical alarm alert as priority;•	Perform initial alarm analysis to identify the problems followed by restoration if possible or act as first level support;•	Keep notified / updating management or other business units informed during system outage;•	Troubleshoot and escalate the issue or incident by coordinating with relevant team or vendor to resolve the issue as soon as possible and ensure comply with SLA timeline;•	Regularly review the performance of IT infrastructure devices and services to prevent unexpected abnormalities or outages occurring;•	Manage and respond to request or incident by open trouble ticket and follow up until the case closed within SLA period;•	Keep tracking and documenting all IT infrastructure’s guideline and diagram to ensure it’s up to date and well organized;•	Perform proper handover and takeover daily duties of each shift by clearly indicating all completed and remaining task to follow up;•	Communicate and liaise with all other bank departments; notify appropriate parties immediately of any issues which may affect efficient operations including, but not limited to, outages, service disruptions;•	Prepare weekly, and monthly report of IT infrastructure services availability;•	Working as shift rotation 24/7 daily, weekend and public holiday;•	Other task will be assigned by line manager.
Job Requirement: •	Experienced with monitoring and troubleshooting of IT infrastructure in banking / telecom industry is preferred;•	Experienced with monitoring systems such as Zabbix, Grafana, Ntop, Nagios, Cacti, or other monitoring tools;•	Good understanding of Window and Linux administration;•	Good understanding of networking concepts including IP protocol, subnetting, VLAN, DHCP, DNS, VPN, DPLC, MPLS, switching, and routing protocols;•	Basic understanding of database structures;•	Basic understanding of VMware environment;•	Basic understanding of data center environment and components such as cooling, power supply, backup generator, etc;•	Good communication in both Khmer and English;•	Proficiency with analytical and problem-solving skills;•	Desire to learn and develop all necessary technical skills;•	Proactive, commitment and good teamwork.
Company Profile: ABA Bank is Cambodia's leading private financial institution (not state-owned enterprise) founded in 1996 as the Advanced Bank of Asia Limited.In over 25 years of development and growth, ABA has significantly strengthened its position in the market and broke into the Top 3 commercial banks of the country. Today, ABA offers the entire spectrum of services to customer segments covering SMEs, micro businesses, and individuals.With 81 branches, 450+ ATMs, 480+ self-banking machines across the country, and advanced online banking and mobile banking platforms ABA Bank reaches out to a large number of customers with an array of modern financial services.

Job Description: • Establish marketing process flow, objectives, and plans to increase market share and profitability of products and/or services• Develop and execute marketing plans and programs, both short and long range, to ensure the profit growth and expansion of MJQ products/services• Research, analyze, and monitor financial, technological, and demographic factors so that market opportunities may be capitalized on and the effects of competitive activity may be minimized• Plan and oversee the organization's all MJQ marketing activities both for both offline and online campaigns. • Communicate and manage outside advertising agencies on outsourced campaigns• Work with copywriters and designers and oversees copywriting, design, layout, paste-up, and production of promotional materials• Analyze and recommend pricing strategy for the organization which results in increased market share per business unit. • Achieve above average share of market performance in relation to pre-set standards and to general and specific trends within the industry and the economy• Ensure effective control of marketing results and that corrective action takes place to be certain that the achievement of marketing objectives is within designated budgets• Evaluate market reactions to advertising programs, education policy, and product knowledge and in conjunction with R&D department to ensure the timely adjustment of marketing strategy and plans to meet changing market and competitive conditions• Proposed changes (if needed) in current structure and organization of marketing group to ensure the effective fulfillment of objectives assigned to it and provide the flexibility to move swiftly in relation to marketing problems and opportunities• Conduct marketing surveys on current and new product concepts• Prepare marketing activity and performance reports by monthly, quarterly, and yearly basis
Job Requirement: • Bachelor University degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Public Relations, or relevant Degree Required • Minimum of 5 years of experience in corporate and consumer marketing.• Leading and executing successful consumer campaigns through execution of ATL/BTL/TTL standard principles• Ability to think creatively and conceptually, from both visual and content standpoints is needed. Identifying and executing the most compelling ways to achieve business objectives through outstanding creative ability. • GMM must have strength in creativity, analytics, deductive reasoning, and market trends awareness in previous experiences. • The ability to set clearly defined processes, targets, and goals while being adaptable has been conveyed in prior work. • English and Khmer fluency (written and oral) • Well-adapted to and/or knowledge of graphic design and video production software • Leadership skills are imperative and must have ability to manage, supervise, discipline staff under he/she jurisdiction • Proactiveness is required and must have innate sense of assigned project urgency • Digital media aptitude is compulsory, he/she must understand metrics, definitions, and online planning and buying methodology and execution. • Need to be equipped with problem solving abilities either through resourcefulness or independent cognitive ability. Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.

- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse

- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits

- Career advancement opportunities

- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Company Profile:
About Smiling Gecko Cambodia:
In 2014, Smiling Gecko Cambodia (SGC) was officially registered as a local NGO in Cambodia. SGC is legally independent of Smiling Gecko Switzerland. Following its mission of «Cambodians help Cambodians», the organization provides direct aid to disadvantaged people in the country, supporting local job initiatives and promoting self-help among the rural population. Apart from providing direct aid and supporting other NGOs, Smiling Gecko, thus, focuses on fighting the causes of poverty and helping people to help themselves. To this end, SGC launched a project on a previously acquired site to the North of Phnom Penh whose objective is to provide several thousand Cambodians with future job training and a regular income in the sectors of agriculture, tourism, industry, and trade. In future, the proceeds are intended to cover the operating costs of the innovative pilot school, which is also part of the cluster and provides education to nearly 1,000 children (from preschool to senior high school).
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department    recruitment@smilinggecko-cambodia.org  Srae Sar village, Tbaeng Khpos commune, Samakki Meanchey district, Kompong Chhnang province, Cambodia.

Job Description:
The key responsibilities of the Bridge Club Agent include but are not limited to:
• Ensure the smooth operation of Front Office and Concierge services to maximize guest comfort.
• Participates in training of all Front Office and Concierge activities.
• Checks guests in and out of the hotel/apartment/office; including groups and organized tours.
• Meet and follow-up guest requests as per arrival and departure lists to ensure guests’ comfort.
• Monitors the registration against in-house guests; Daily screening and checks.
• Ensure all duties are completed in a timely and organized manner. (I.e. VIP list, arrivals, blocking rooms, in house bucket); communicates information to the associated departments.
• Resolves guest and associate complaints and issues.
• Communicates clearly with Duty Manager of daily regime at the Front Desk.
• Will include rotation for night duties (Night Audits and Front Desk operations).
• Understands the need and willingness to work in other related departments during peak periods as required (i.e. Housekeeping and Reservation).
• Maintain professional business confidentiality.
Job Requirement:
Skills, Qualifications and Attributes:
• Fluent written and spoken English; Chinses (Mandarin) would be considered an added asset.
• Cheerful and bubbly deposition an added advantage.
• Post-secondary education in Hospitality Management, or equivalent experience of at least 6 months.
• Computer Skills - Demonstrated ability with regard to computer skills, including experience using hotel booking programs.
• Attention to detail - Able to maintain sustained level of concentration. 
• Service Orientation - Displays a commitment to quality guest service at all times, values the supplying of accurate and timely information and relates to people from diverse backgrounds.
• Professionalism - Regulates own behavior, understanding the hotel culture and acts appropriately in the execution of duties.

SECONDARY RESPONSIBILITIES:
- Assist the Housekeeping / Reservation operations when require.

Working hours:
- Morning shift 7am to 3:30pm & 8am to 5pm 
- Afternoon shift: 3pm to 11:30pm

Job Description:
- Provide leadership to departments under control. Coach, mentor and develop direct reports and manage a high performing team that delivers continuous improvement, added value and cost reductions.
- Set department objectives and monitor ongoing progress and performance.
- Ensure strong communication between teams under leadership to facilitate exchange of information and in order to implement change and improvements.
- Ensure that the function operates in accordance with any health, safety and environmental policies and procedures to ensure the safety and wellbeing of staff and visitors.
- Responsible for developing the appropriate organizational structure, resource plans and culture to support the business objectives and customer deliverables.
- Provide leadership, coordination and coaching to the team, ensuring they are trained enabling them to achieve the operational and financial metrics within their areas of responsibility and succeed in their roles.
- Complete regular performance reviews, manage attendance, holidays, disciplinary issues and procedures as appropriate.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

៦ ធានារាល់ការ បញ្ជារទិញគ្រប់មុខទំនិញឬផលិតផល ត្រូវធានានូវគុណភាព សុវត្តិភាព ការផ្គត់ផ្គង់ ឲ្យសមស្របតាមបរិមាណនៃការលក់

Job Description:
Tax reporting and management (40%): 
- Handle tax reporting for both CMA, APL entities , such as :  VAT, WHT, TOP, PTOP, patent tax
- Work with local finance team , SSCI, and related departments to ensure tax reporting, filing and accounting compliance in each company code
- Issue monthly sales invoices (corporate)
- Coordinate with HR for TOS, TOFB
- Prepare, coordinate and follow up with EY for assist in the computation and declaration
- Liaison and follow up with EY ensure payment and filling within deadline
- Prepare monthly carrier tax report and payment  (VAT + PPT)
- Reconciliation tax reporting details to GL transaction for both BS/PL accounts
- Reconciliation Tax reporting , payment and obligations to tax department’s records
- Assist in provision of  related data and supporting documents for tax and statutory audits
- Keep track of document filling and archiving following to company policy

Tax admin and audit coordinator (20%)
- Act as local contact point for tax , audit legal matter
- Regularly liaison with tax authority and update tax regulation to distribute the information to team and management
- Support in preparation required document to tax audit
- Assist in coordinate with local consultant and regulator when required
- Promptly report to direct manager for tax issues or tax requirement

Other responsibilities (30%):
Treasury coordinator :
- Coordinate with Treasury team (regional and Vietnam) in case of preparation and submission documents to bank for opening bank account, register internet Banking , remove and add signatories
- Prepare monthly cash forecast
Intercompany transaction:
Monthly rebilling (Agency cost) from Viet Nam and other CMA entities Monthly MGA payment preparation and following up

Ad – hoc  (10%)
- Other tasks assigned by Management
- Participate in financial projects where required
Job Requirement:
Education: Degree holding in Accounting & Finance
Functional  knowledge & Experiences: At least 2 or 3 year experience in similar position
Communication: Active, Dynamic, Persuasive
Innovation : Think ahead, proactive
Critical work behavior: Customer focus, results oriented, Resourceful, team spirit,
Language: Good at English
Computer: MS office, Software / IT application

Now headed by Rodolphe Saadé, CMA CGM reinvents transport and logistics in order to offer an integrated maritime, port and land service that exceeds its customers' expectations. Present in over 160 countries through 755 offices, 750 warehouses, equipped with a young and diverse fleet of 511 vessels, CMA CGM serves 420 of the world's 521 commercial ports and operates on more than 200 shipping lines. The group currently employs 110,000 people worldwide, including nearly 2,400 in Marseille, in its headquarters in Marseilles

Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. The Bank's Memorandum and Articles of

Job Description:
Reporting Line: Managing Director

Key objectives of the role

- Developing a Strategic Marketing Plan for each brand (all business under EFG Cambodia) with initial focus on Dairy Queen, Kamu Kamu and Hungry?
- Long term objective will be to develop and review annually a Strategic Marketing Plan for each of EFGs brand portfolio, including new brand acquisitions and new countries.
- This will involve understanding the brands DNA, market research, where applicable, including organizing focus groups internally and with consumers to understand and explore consumer insights and areas of potential differentiation
- The Group Strategic Marketing Manager will provide leadership, guidance, and direction to EFGs Creative Leader and Store Design Leader to ensure the strategic marketing vision is articulated via our creative marketing collateral and store design.
- Other duties assigned by senior management
Job Requirement:
Job Requirement

1. Experienced in senior manager and strategic  level  preferably of multi brand, multi-site operations and leadership of a marketing team . Ideally experienced research and study about customer behavior and marketing research.
2. Strong Planning and Organization Skills, Digital Innovation and Creativity
3. Personality Traits - energy, enthusiasm, passion, dynamism, results driven, action orientated, prepared to take risks (step out of comfort zone), team player, influencer, strong communicator, user of digital media.
4. Love to challenge and having sense of urgency .
5. Travel Requirement: Yes



Due to a large number of applicants, we will only be able to follow up with candidates who are shortlisted for an interview, and this will happen within 10 working days from the date of your application.
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information EFG Cambodia   017 888 349 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #320, Mao Tse Tong Blvd, Sangkat Tek Laak 1, Khan Toul Kok 017 888 349

Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. Job Description:
Managing the end-to-end delivery of all IT and digital initiatives
Organizing and managing all phases of the projects to ensure on-time completion, thus developing project plans and roadmaps, defining goals and budgets as well as identifying resources needed
Analyze and deliver reports in line with the reporting requirements of the project and stakeholders
Coordinate planning and project timelines with cross-functional teams
Assembling and coordinating project team members; assigning individual responsibilities
Report on the projects' status (scope, planning, issues, risks) to the different stakeholders
Manage project documentation, status tracking, and delivery of overall projects
Ensure smooth handovers to the operational teams and users (incl. documentation, training, follow-ups, etc.)
Job Requirement:
At least 5 years of experience as Project Manager / Project Coordinator
Knowledge and experience of PM, analysis, and reporting-related tools
Solid technical background, with understanding and hands-on experience in software development, mobile app and web technologies
Ability to thrive in a fast paced working environment and work under pressure.
Strong project management, effective communication skills, and the ability to build effective working relationships
Attention to detail, working to tight deadlines, ability to manage priorities well, high standards and attention to detail, and knowledge of best practices
Self-starter, comfortable working independently with minimal supervision
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Good command of both written and spoken English
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description:
Work with business and to design and develop technical requirements.
Develop accurate and efficient programs with unit tests according to the requirements.
Maintain current knowledge of standard language, coding conventions, and operations requirements.
Build and deploy code to several environment (i.e. Development, SIT, UAT).
Support, investigate and analyze the root causes of reported issues/defect/problem of the developed application.
Consult with users, analyze requirements and recommend technical specification

Minimum 3 years experience as back end developer
Strong problem solving skill, good attitude and teamwork.
Experience and knowledge in Web service development based on J2EE framework including Servlet, Java beans, EJB, JMS, JavaMail, Web Services, HTML, XML, UML etc will advantage
Using enterprise level database 
Strong knowledge in OOP software and REST/SOAP web services design and implementation.
Experience in configuration and setup of AWS

Experience in developing software in Agile/Scrum process is a plus.
Good command of both written and spoken English

Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. Job Description:
Build effective visualizations to communicate data to key decision-makers
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Communicate findings to cross-functional peers and management
Analyze complex and large datasets from multiple sources, turning big data into impactful insights
Improve business performance by identifying sources of growth, pinpointing issues
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Training end-users on new reports and dashboards
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Job Requirement:
At least 1+ years of experience as Business & Data Analyst
Expertise in Power BI, Python, SQL, Microsoft Office: PowerPoint, Excel, Word
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc), databases (SQL etc), programming (XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks)
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Ability and experience in extracting insights from data, and summarizing learning/takeaways
Good command of both written and spoken English
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description: •	Conduct operation and compliance audit at branches and business units•	Draft internal audit report for Internal Audit Department Manager to review•	Assist in evaluating operational efficiencies and contribute to improve overall structure and practices •	Assist in developing audit planning and detect key weakness areas•	Monitor and enforce compliance with banking regulation and accounting standards•	Follow up on the progress of implementation and recommendation•	Assist tracking all audit issues and management's corrective action to final resolution •	Check compliance with internal established policies, procedures and regulations•	Assist audit team in conducting spot check •	Perform other related duties as assigned
Job Requirement:
Skills/ Experiences
•	Bachelor degree in Auditing, Finance, Accounting or other related fields 
•	Fresh graduate are welcome.
•	Fluency of English and Khmer in both speaking and writing
•	Strong analytical skill and ability to check and diagnose problems
•	Strong organizational, interpersonal, team player and good negotiation skills
•	Computer Literacy in MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
•	Willingness to travel to provinces
Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. Job Description:
Managing the end-to-end delivery of all IT and digital initiatives
Organizing and managing all phases of the projects to ensure on-time completion, thus developing project plans and roadmaps, defining goals and budgets as well as identifying resources needed
Analyze and deliver reports in line with the reporting requirements of the project and stakeholders
Coordinate planning and project timelines with cross-functional teams
Assembling and coordinating project team members; assigning individual responsibilities
Report on the projects' status (scope, planning, issues, risks) to the different stakeholders
Manage project documentation, status tracking, and delivery of overall projects
Ensure smooth handovers to the operational teams and users (incl. documentation, training, follow-ups, etc.)
Job Requirement:
At least 5 years of experience as Project Manager / Project Coordinator
Knowledge and experience of PM, analysis, and reporting-related tools
Solid technical background, with understanding and hands-on experience in software development, mobile app and web technologies
Ability to thrive in a fast paced working environment and work under pressure.
Strong project management, effective communication skills, and the ability to build effective working relationships
Attention to detail, working to tight deadlines, ability to manage priorities well, high standards and attention to detail, and knowledge of best practices
Self-starter, comfortable working independently with minimal supervision
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
Good command of both written and spoken English

• Know how the digital marketing work
• Good Communication
• Able to work with AI, Photoshop , design tool,
• ability to do photo and video shooting is a plus
• Good Time management skill and able to complete within deadline


Due to a large number of applicants, we will only be able to follow up with candidates who are shortlisted for an interview, and this will happen within 10 working days from the date of your application.
Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information EFG Cambodia   017 888 349 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #320, Mao Tse Tong Blvd, Sangkat Tek Laak 1, Khan Toul Kok 017 888 349

Job Description:
This role is responsible for servicing the clients who come to the branch counter. The incumbent will build a thorough understanding of each client financial requirements and will focus on providing best services to retain and build deeper relationships with clients.

Main Duties

•	Process banking transaction for the customers following FTB service standards
•	Act as a key advocate to existing and potential customers
•	Proactively determine customer’s need to actively sell the bank’s full range of product and services
•	Keep update on product knowledge and policies
•	Ensure transactional processing is efficient and accurate 
•	Assist others where needed
Job Requirement:
Skills/ Experiences

•	Bachelor Degree in Banking or related field
•	One year experience in customer service, cashier/teller with banking/MFIs 
•	Strong customer service and sales-oriented personality
•	Good organizational and time management skills
•	A strong desire to work in a team 
•	English language proficiency, Chinese language is a plus
•	Computer literacy in Microsoft Office Word & Excel
How to Apply:
Interested applicants, please send by email attached with a cover letter and your most updated CV (with current photo) to: hr@ftbbank.com or submit the hard copy at Our Head Office, Building No. 33 C-D, Tchecoslovaquie Blvd(169), Sangkat Veal Vong, Khan 7Makara Phnom Penh. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted for interview.
Please visit our website: http://www.ftbbank.com/vacant-and-career for more available vacancy
Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. The Bank's Memorandum and Articles of
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  023862111 hr@ftb.com.kh Building No. 33 C-D, Tchecoslovaquie Blvd (169), Sangkat Veal Vong, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 023862111

Job Description: ថែរក្សា សំអាតសាច់ប្រាក់ ដែលមាននៅក្នុងឃ្លាំងប្រាក់ទាំងអស់ ទុកដាក់ឱ្យបានត្រឹមត្រូវ និងមានសុវត្ថិភាព តាមលក្ខណៈបច្ចេកទេស ។រៀបចំសាច់ប្រាក់ទៅតាមលក្ខណៈបច្ចេកទេស និងគ្រប់គ្រងនៅក្នុងឃ្លាំង ឱ្យបានត្រឹមត្រូវ និងច្បាស់លាស់ ។រៀបចំរបាយការណ៍បូកសរុបសាច់ប្រាក់ជាក់ស្តែងនៅក្នុងឃ្លាំងប្រាក់ ប្រភេទក្រដាសប្រាក់ ដើម្បីងាយស្រួលគ្រប់គ្រងសាច់ប្រាក់ មានគ្រប់គ្រាន់តាមតម្រូវការរបស់សាខា ឬសម្រាប់ប្រើប្រាស់ដាក់ទូអេធីអឹម ។កត់ត្រាបញ្ចូលទិន្នន័យក្នុងប្រព័ន្ធធនាគារ ឱ្យបានត្រឹមត្រូវ ច្បាស់លាស់ និងទាន់ពេល នូវគ្រប់ប្រតិបតិ្តការផ្ទេរប្រាក់ទៅ មកពីបេឡាគ្រប់គ្រងឃ្លាំងប្រាក់ ទៅបេឡាធិការ ផ្ទេរប្រាក់ទៅមកទៅសាខា និងផ្ទេរប្រាក់ទៅមកទៅធនាគារជាតិ ។ជ្រើសរើស ប្រភេទក្រដាសប្រាក់ ក្រដាសប្រាក់ថ្មីៗ ឬមធ្យម និងត្រៀមប្រាក់ជាស្រេច សម្រាប់ដាក់ក្នុងម៉ាស៊ីនអេធីអឹម ទាន់ពេលវេលា ។ដាក់ប្រាក់ចូលក្នុងម៉ាស៊ីនអេធីអឹម រាប់ប្រាក់សំណល់ពីអេធីអឹម ផ្ទៀងផ្ទាត់ប្រាក់ជាក់ស្តែង ជាមួយវិក័យបត្រ ។គោរពតាមគោលការណ៍ សេចក្តីណែនាំ និងនិតិវិធីរបស់ធនាគារអោយមានប្រសិទ្ធភាពខ្ពស់ការងារផ្សេងៗទៀតតាមការចាត់តាំងរបស់ថ្នាក់គ្រប់គ្រង ។
Job Requirement: បរិញ្ញបត្រ ផ្នែកធនាគារ និងហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ គណនេយ្យ ឬផ្នែកជំនាញដែលពាក់ព័ន្ធមានចំណេះជំនាញវិជ្ជាជីវៈ និងគ្រប់គ្រងពេលវេលាបានល្អមានភាពស្មោះត្រង់ សុចរិតភាព មានការអត់ធ្មត់ខ្ពស់ ទំនួលខុសត្រូវខ្ពស់ និងហ្មត់ចត់ក្នុងការងារបេក្ខជនដែលមានបទសោធន៍ ត្រូវបានជ្រើសជាអាទិភាពអាចធ្វើការងារជាក្រុម មានការសហការល្អ ចេះបត់បែនក្នុងការងារ និងមានជំនាញក្នុងការដោះស្រាយបញ្ហាមានជំនាញទំនាក់ទំនង និងកសាងទំនាក់ទំនងល្អទាំងក្នុង និងក្រៅស្ថាប័នមានចំណេះដឹងភាសាអង់គ្លេស និងអាចប្រើប្រាស់កុំព្យូទ័របានស្ទាត់ជំនាញ (Microsoft Office Word & Excel)

job title: ភ្នាក់ងារសន្តិសុខ
position: ភ្នាក់ងារសន្តិសុខ
Job Description: ថែទាំ និងរក្សានូវសន្តិសុខ សណ្តាប់ធ្នាប់ និងសុវត្ថិភាព ជូនអតិថិជនទាំងខាងក្នុង និងខាងក្រៅ ដើម្បីផ្តល់នូវជំនឿទុកចិត្តជូនអតិថិជន ក៏ដូចសាធារណៈជនរៀបចំសម្រួលចំណតចេញ-ចូល ជូនអតិថិជនទាំងខាងក្នុង និងខាងក្រៅ របស់ធនាគារ ឲ្យមានរបៀបរាបរយ តាមលក្ខណៈបច្ចេកទេសសម្រួលចំណតចេញ-ចូល និងធ្វើចរាចរណ៍ ឲ្យបានទាន់ពេលវេលា ធានាបាននូវភាពមិនកកស្ទះចរាចរណ៍ នៅមុខការិយាល័យ
Job Requirement: យ៉ាងតិចមានសញ្ញាបត្របឋមភូមិ (សញ្ញាបត្រថ្នាក់ទី ៩​ (Bac I))។ជានីតិជន ដែលមានសញ្ជាតិជាខ្មែរ និងចេះអាន សរសេរ ភាសាខ្មែរបានល្អ។ ចេះភាសាអង់គ្លេស ត្រូវបានលើកទឹកចិត្ត។មានបទពិសោធន៍ពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹងកិច្ចការសន្តិសុខ សណ្តាប់ធ្នាប់សាធារណៈ ត្រូវបានផ្តល់អាទិភាព។
Company Profile:
FTB is Cambodia's first and foremost bank. It is a private commercial bank and has been providing customers with safe and reliable banking services for 40 years. 

The Bank was created following Sub-decree No. 1213 dated 10 October 1979 under the former regime of the State of Cambodia. In 2000, the Bank was          separated from the direct management of the National Bank of Cambodia ("the Central Bank") in order to transform its permanent identity into a state-owned commercial bank in Cambodia with the features of a Public Economic Enterprise and with the intention of conducting autonomous business              operations. 

In January 2001, the Bank obtained its banking license from the Central Bank to operate as a commercial bank in the Kingdom of Cambodia for a period of      three years starting from 4 January 2001. This was the first license granted to enable the Bank to operate as a separate legal entity independent from the Central Bank's direct management. On 8 January 2004, the Bank obtained its 2nd banking license from the Central Bank for a period of three years starting    from that date. The Bank now holds a commercial banking license, which was renewed for an indefinite period, on 21 December 2006

On 31 December 2002, the Ministry of Economy and Finance ("MEF") announced, through a Statement of Intent, the privatisation of the Bank as part of the   reform of the financial sector of the Royal Government of Cambodia. On 28 October 2005 the shareholders of the Bank, represented by the Privatisation   Committee, entered into a sales agreement with Canadia Bank and ING Holding Company. The Central Bank sold its 20% shareholding in the Bank and MEF   reduced its 80% shareholding to 10%. In 2009, in accordance with the recommendation of the Central Bank, Canadia Bank reduced its shares from 48% to  15.22% and 2 new private shareholders having respectively a share of 15.39%, entered the capital of FTB. The Bank's Memorandum and Articles of
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  023862111 hr@ftb.com.kh Phnom Penh Building No. 33 C-D, Tchecoslovaquie Blvd (169), Sangkat Veal Vong, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 023862111

Job Description: សំអាតបរិវេណក្នុង-ក្រៅការិយាល័យ បន្ទប់ទឹក ចង្រ្កានបាយ ចំណតយានយន្ត និងឧបករណ៍-សម្ភារឱ្យមានរបៀបរៀបរយ អនាម័យ និងសោភ័ណភាពជានិច្ច ។រៀបចំឱ្យមានគ្រប់គ្រាន់ ព្រមទាំងត្រួតពិនិត្យជាប្រចាំនូវកន្រ្តក់ ឬធុងសំរាមតាមតុធ្វើការ និងរៀបចំឱ្យមានគ្រប់គ្រាន់នូវសម្ភារប្រើប្រាស់ក្នុងបន្ទប់ទឹក / បង្គន់ ធានាមិនឱ្យមានក្លិនអាក្រក់កើតឡើង ។រៀបចំផ្តល់ភេសជ្ជៈ (ទឹកក្តៅ-ត្រជាក់) សម្រាប់ភ្ញៀវ និងនិយោជិតឱ្យបានគ្រប់គ្រាន់ និងមានអនាម័យ ។បោកគក់សំអាតវាំងនន កម្រាលតុ កន្សែងជូតដៃ និងរបស់របរផ្សេងៗទៀតឱ្យបានស្អាតជាប្រចាំ ។ចូលរួមសន្សំសំចៃលើការប្រើប្រាស់ថាមពលអគ្គិសនី និងទឹក នៅក្នុងបរិវេណ អគារការិយាល័យ និងបន្ទប់ទឹកទាំងអស់ របស់ធនាគារ ។រាយការណ៍ជូនអ្នកគ្រប់គ្រង អំពីការមិនចូលរួមថែរក្សាអនាម័យរបស់បុគ្គលិកក្នុងបរិវេណការិយាល័យធនាគារ ។ធ្វើការងារផ្សេងទៀត តាមការចាត់តាំងរបស់អ្នកគ្រប់គ្រង។
Job Requirement: យ៉ាងតិចមានសញ្ញាបត្របឋមភូមិ (សញ្ញាបត្រថ្នាក់ទី ៩ -ជាប់ឌីប្លូម ) ។ជានីតិជន ដែលមានសញ្ជាតិជាខ្មែរ និងចេះអាន សរសេរ ភាសាខ្មែរបានល្អ ។ ចេះភាសាអង់គ្លេស ត្រូវបានលើកទឹកចិត្ត ។មានភាពស្មោះត្រង់ សុចរិតភាព អត់ធ្មត់ និងសកម្មលើការងារ ។ មានបទពិសោធន៍ពាក់ព័ន្ធនឹងអនាម័យ ត្រូវបានផ្តល់អាទិភាពមានលក្ខណៈសម្បត្តិក្នុងការប្រាស្រ័យទាក់ទងល្អ រួសរាយ រាក់ទាក់ និងមានឥរិយាបថចេះបម្រើអតិថិជន ។អាចលះបង់នូវពេលវេលាផ្ទាល់ខ្លួន ដើម្បីទទួលនូវការបម្រើជូនធនាគារ និងអតិថិជនបានល្អ ។មានស្មារតីទទួលខុសត្រូវខ្ពស់ក្នុងការងារ ក៏ដូចជាលក្ខខណ្ឌការងាររបស់ធនាគារ ។
