Job Requirement: Requirements & Qualifications• At least Bachelor Degree in Accounting or similar.• At least 3 years experiences in accounting and taxation.• Previous experience of accounting software and knowledge of accounting principle & practices.• Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel and Accounting Software (Sage300 is a must or other accounting software).• Honest and reliable person.• Motivated, resourceful, independent with a strong sense of professionalism.• Able to work under pressure.• Good command in English for both written and spoken.• Team work player with good analytical.* Other benefits:- Work day: Monday to Friday and Half-Saturday- Insurance (Accident & Health)- Annual salary review - Paid annual leave day- Annual year-end party- and many more* Salary: Negotiable (based on qualification and experience)

Job Description: - Manage property maintenance projects- Lead property landscaping and housekeeping projects- Set up annual maintenance, landscaping housekeeping budget- Work closely with all contractors to complete all construction projects- Produce preventive planned maintenance (PPM)- Spearhead building safety management plan and construction health and safety- Maintain property by investigating and resolving tenant complaints, enforcing rules occupancy,- Inspecting vacant units and liaising with engineering team for repairs and planning renovation- Collaborate with Sales Department and Leasing Department to create tenants/owner data- Set, prepare and conduct annual fire drills, property evacuation procedures and related safety trainings- Fully oversee and be responsible for the day-to-day managerial and financial operation of the property management including leading all associated supervisory and administration personnel- Set, implement and monitor operation standards for all aspects of the property management- Oversee and well-managed engineering team and operation team of all properties.

Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

Job Description:
1) Conduct preliminary audit analyses to identifying the risks and ensure that risks are taken in to
consideration and identified, and audit activities meet the scope and objectives of KC.
2) Supervise the audit team ( if any) to execute the audit program by selecting the right transactions,
clients, and others from officer, section, department, and branch in order to ensure that the cost
effectiveness of audit mission, internal control design and implementation are properly identified
and confirmed.
3) Review policies, procedures, and perform the audit testing on key and complex financial &
operational transactions, such as reports, analyses, and documents in order to evaluate the quality of
internal control design and implementation of KC.
4) Review audit working paper and evidences of the assigned audit missions in order to make sure that
completeness of audit finding, root cause, implication and recommendations are well identified.
5) Collect sufficient and appropriate audit evidences related to specific process of risk profiling.
6) Prepare drafted audit report of the assigned missions and participate in presentation to Internal Audit
Manager in order to make sure that they are well understood about detail audit findings and
recommendations.
7) Provide on-the-job training to new team member to comply with audit procedures and programs.
8) Assist Internal Audit Manager to create KPIs and Department object.
9) Conduct annual performance review on time basis.
10) Anticipate any meeting, training, workshop, conference, seminar outside as assign by Internal Audit
Manager.
11) Other task assign by Internal Audit Manager.
Job Requirement:
1) Degree in Business Administration or pursuing ACCA/CPA is preferable.
2) Minimum 3 years of work experience in auditing or related field and prefer from Bank or MFIs.
3) Knowledge in audit, accounting, financial analysis and compliance.
4) Good organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills.
5) Good verbal and written communication in Khmer and English.
6) Strong skill in Ms. Office (Words, Excel, Power point, Outlook, etc.)
7) Good at interpersonal skill, flexible, friendly, team build, and goal oriented,
8) Good of English for both writing and speaking,
9) And can work under pressure and deadline committed.

Job Description:
1) Participate with Compliance Manager in conducting of compliance task all areas where it has been
indicated.
2) Review policies and procedures and ensure The Institution’s operation fully comply with applicable
laws and regulation especially from National Bank of Cambodia (NBC).
3) Provide immediate recommendations on non-compliance of The Institution’s operation to Chairman,
CEO, Managers, or other related personnel.
4) Liaise with government officials or regulators on corporate task of The Institution.
5) Performs investigation when there is some misconduct or break of policies and procedure.
6) Assist Compliance Manager to create or develop, amend policies and procedures for operation to
prevent illegal, unethical or improper implement.
7) Prepare any document or report to NBC (Appointment personnel, AML, etc.), Ministry, Customers
or other related parties.
8) Keep inform or sharing of any amendment or updating national laws, Prakas, and regulations from
Ministry and NBC.
9) Provide necessary training on compliance to all related staff and ensure they are aware including
policies, control mechanisms and charnel of reporting.
10) Other task assign by Compliance Manager.
Job Requirement:
1) Bachelor or Master’s degree in Law, Banking and Finance, Business Administration, and other,

job title: អាហារូបករណ៍ក្រោមកម្មវិធីកែទម្រង់ការគ្រប់គ្រងហរិញ្ញវត្ថុសាធារណៈ
position: អាហារូបករណ៍ក្រោមកម្មវិធីកែទម្រង់ការគ្រប់គ្រងហរិញ្ញវត្ថុសាធារណៈ
Job Description:
ក. អត្ថប្រយោជន៍ទទួលបាន
បេក្ខជន/បេក្ខនារីដែលជាប់អាហារូបករណ៍កម្មវិធីកែទម្រង់ការគ្រប់គ្រងហិរញ្ញវត្ថុសាធារណៈ នឹងទទួលបាន អត្ថប្រយោជន៍រួមមានៈ ថ្លៃកម្មវិធីសិក្សា ដំណើរទស្សនកិច្ចសិក្សាទៅកាន់សាកលវិទ្យាល័យសាន់វ៉េ ក្នុងប្រទេសម៉ាឡេស៊ី ចំនួន ០២លើក (ទស្សនកិច្ចសិក្សាមុនចាប់ផ្តើមការសិក្សា និងការធ្វើដំណើរទៅ សាកលវិទ្យាល័យ សម្រាប់ ធ្វើការ ការពារនិក្ខេបទសម្រាប់ការបញ្ចប់សិក្សា)។    

ខ. លក្ខខណ្ឌជ្រើសរើសបេក្ខភាព
១). មានសញ្ជាតិខ្មែរ
២). មានសញ្ញាបត្រ ថ្នាក់បរិញ្ញាបត្រ ផ្នែកសេដ្ឋកិច្ច ហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ គ្រប់គ្រង ឬប្រហាក់ប្រហែល
៣). មានបទពិសោធន៍ការងារ យ៉ាងតិច០២ឆ្នាំ
៤). មានកម្រិតភាសាអង់គ្លេសល្អ (IELTS 6.5 Overall band) ឬ លិខិតបញ្ជាក់ពីសាលាលើកម្មវិធី 
      សិក្សាថ្នាក់បរិញ្ញាបត្រជាភាសាអង់គ្លេស
៥). បេក្ខជន/បេក្ខនារី នឹងតម្រូវឲ្យសរសេរបាយការណ៏សិក្សាស្រាវជ្រាវ (ប្រធានបទនឹងផ្តល់ជូនតាម 
      ក្រោយដោយគណៈកម្មការវាយតម្លៃ)
Job Requirement:
គ. ឯកសារភ្ជាប់
បេក្ខជន/បេក្ខនារីត្រូវភ្ជាប់មកជាមួយនូវឯកសារខាងក្រោមៈ
-	ប្រវត្តិរូបសង្ខេប ភ្ជាប់ជាមួយនឹង Motivation Letter/ Personal statement ជាភាសាអង់គ្លេស
-	សញ្ញាបត្រ ព្រឹត្តិបត្រពិន្ទុ និងឯកសារពាក់ព័ន្ធផ្សេងទៀតជាភាសាអង់គ្លេស ថតចម្លង ០១ច្បាប់។   
ឃ. កាលបរិច្ឆេទ និងកន្លែងទទួលពាក្យ
បេក្ខជន/បេក្ខនារីដែលមានបំណងចូលរួមក្នុងកម្មវិធីអាហារូបករណ៍នេះ សូមផ្ញើឯកសារភ្ជាប់ឲ្យបានត្រឹមត្រូវ ដូចដែលបានរៀបរាប់ខាងលើ តាមរយៈសារអេឡិចត្រូនិច (Email)  ឬនៅអាស័យដ្ឋានខាងក្រោមរាល់ម៉ោងធ្វើការ យ៉ាងយូរបំផុតត្រឹមថ្ងៃទី១៣ ខែកុម្ភៈ ឆ្នាំ២០២៣ វេលាម៉ោង៥ និង ៣០នាទី ល្ងាច។ 
ក្រសួងសេដ្ឋកិច្ចនិងហិរញ្ញវត្ថុ
ផ្លូវលេខ ៩២ សង្កាត់វត្តភ្នំ ខណ្ឌដូនពេញ រាជធានីភ្នំពេញ
អគ្គលេខាធិការដ្ឋានគណៈកម្មាធិការដឹកនាំការងារកែទម្រង់ការគ្រប់គ្រងហិរញ្ញវត្ថុសាធារណៈ
បន្ទប់អគ្គលេខាធិការដ្ឋានកំណែទម្រង់ អគារ “គ” ជាន់ទី៧

Job Description:
•   Enforce rules for behavior and procedures for maintaining order among the students

•  Participates in and contributes to the teaching profession;
•  Sponsor extracurricular activities such as clubs, student organizations, and academic contests
•  Select, store, order, issue, and inventory classroom equipment, materials, and supplies
•  Enforces regulations concerning student conduct and discipline
•  Prepare students for later grades or levels by encouraging them to explore learning opportunities and to persevere with challenging tasks
•  Assign and grade class work and homework
•  Establish clear objectives for all lessons, units, and projects, and communicate those objectives to students
•  Instruct students individually and in groups, using various teaching methods such as lectures, discussions, and demonstrations.
•  Prepare materials and classrooms for class activities.
•  Observe and evaluate students' performance, behavior, social development, and physical health
•  Perform other tasks assigned by upper manager

Job Description:
I. Background
EWMI, an independent not-for-profit organization founded in New York, USA, has been implementing projects in Cambodia since 2003. EWMI works to strengthen Cambodian society by
bringing together government, civil society and the private sector.

II. Scope of Work

1. Grant Management, Monitoring & Evaluation
 Monitor, evaluate and document grantee performance to ensure compliance with donor rules and regulations as outlined in the relevant grants manual.
 Monitor timely submission and conduct initial review of financial, technical and milestone reports submitted by grantees.
 Submit quarterly narrative reports on grantee activities (applies to only one project).
 Close out grants by performing financial and internal reviews, as needed.

2. Stakeholder Engagement and Capacity Building
 Actively coordinate EWMI efforts with prime contractor, informing EWMI colleagues about project developments and required action as needed (applies to only one project).
 Develop and maintain effective relationships with grantee partners.
 Assist in facilitating effective communication with grantees; ensure that grantees receive needed information in a timely and appropriate manner, and ensure coordination between grantees and other EWMI staff, as needed or assigned.
 With the guidance of advisors and the EWMI Country Representative, develop and deliver capacity building activities on skills to enable grantees to improve their financial reports and prevent and address fraud, if appropriate.

3. Grant –Making
 Organize grant competitions and grant review committees.
 Review proposals to determine that minimum requirements have been met.
 Summarize and pre-assess both the proposals and capacity of applicants to guide and support the work of the Grant Review Committee; conduct and document preliminary risk
assessment.
 Negotiate and advise on milestones and budget revisions to proposals recommended for funding, as assigned.
 Complete vetting process for all intended recipients and produce final risk assessment documentation to be included in audit file as needed.
 Orient grantees to grant requirements and expectations.

4. Administration (in coordination with Director of Finance and Operations)
 Document contacts, correspondence, communication and ongoing work with and about grantees and maintain assigned files to defined standards.
 Prepare and submit timely, accurate and complete financial reports, in keeping with EWMI and project requirements and standards.
 Review monthly and quarterly financial reports, disbursement projection requests and milestone reports from partners.
 Ensure all relevant and critical documentation is passed to Audit Files Custodian in a timely fashion.
 Travel to site visits with grantees, as needed.
 Perform other duties, as needed or requested.
Job Requirement:
III. Qualifications
 Previous experience working in the same or similar tasks, preferably on projects funded by the US Government
 Experience with fixed amount award grants is a plus
 Superior accounting and financial management skills
 Demonstrated strong organizational skills
 Demonstrated strong problem-solving skills
 Demonstrated high level of interpersonal and communication skills
 Skilled writer in Khmer and English
 Strong team player
 Working knowledge of computer skills
 Bachelor’s Degree in management, accounting, business, finance or other relevant field.

IV. How to apply
Closing date for all applications: 5:30pm, Friday February 17th Interested candidates should submit a brief cover letter and CV (including the names and contact information for three professional references) by email to:
Ms. Houy Leakhena, Director of Finance and Operations: infocambodia@ewmi.org.

Please include the position title of “Grants Finance and Partnership Manager” in the subject line.
We accept applications by email only. EWMI does not discriminate on the basis of ethnicity, race,
age, gender, or sexual orientation. Only short-listed candidates will be contacted.
Company Profile: About EWMI: Founded in 1988 as an independent, not-for-profit organization, East-West Management Institute, Inc. (EWMI) promotes the rule of law, civil society, and free market systems globally.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department   infocambodia@ewmi.org No. 707, Street 95 Sangkat Beng Kengkang3 Khan Chamkarmorn Phnom Penh, Cambodia

Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Job Description:
** Roles and Responsibilities: The main roles of the post are 
-	Contribute with own expertise of reporting and accounting to the development of a long-term strategy of accounting & reporting team for finance department and in align with the business strategy & priorities.
-	Lead and coordinate all transactional accounting activities of purchase to pay, Record to report and order to cash, ensuring all transitions are properly executed on time.
-	Manage and control each monthly accounting close, as well as the elaboration of accounting information to senior management team.
-	Coordinate our company reporting models, providing all the necessary information for decision-making purposes, as well as a quality analysis regarding the development of our company's main key drive.
-	Ensures and control the preparation of the consolidated management reports (i.e business performance review, Monthly balance sheet, etc.) with the purpose of supporting the company performance analysis and any decision-making for the management team
-	Effectively coordinate with external auditor and prepare statutory report for audited finance statement.
-	Forecasting and Budgeting for Company
-	Drive and support the development/improvement of the new processes, Tools, Templates and support system, with clear.
-	Support Companion Tax Agenda with compliance to the general department of taxation in regarding to VAT, WHT with the accounting transaction and other tax provisions and regulations.
-	Other tasks assigned by MD.

-	Controlling:
o	Direct the preparation of financial reports that summarize and forecast the organization’s financial position, such as income statements, balance sheets, and analyses of future earnings or expenses.
o	Prepare special reports required by governmental agencies that regulate businesses. Often, controllers oversee the accounting, audit, and budget departments of their organization.

-	Treasury: 
o	Direct their organization’s budgets to meet its financial goals.
o	Oversee the investment of funds and carry out strategies to raise capital (such as issuing stocks or bonds) to support the firm’s expansion. 
o	Develop financial plans for mergers (two companies joining together) and acquisitions (one company buying another).

-	Credit Management:
o	Oversee their firm’s credit business by setting credit-rating criteria, determining credit ceilings, and monitoring the collections of past-due accounts.

- Cash management: 
•	Monitor and control the flow of cash that comes in and goes out of the company to meet the company’s business and investment needs. 
•	Must project cash flow (amounts coming in and going out) to determine whether the company will not have enough cash and will need a loan or will have more cash than needed and so can invest some of its money.

-	Risk analysis & Management:
•	Work out with procurement team, top management to prevent impact of import and other related tax to project
•	Assist Head of Accounting & Finance to produce proper Risk Management Report.
•	Control financial risk by using hedging and other strategies to limit or offset the probability of a financial loss or a company’s exposure to financial uncertainty
•	Limit are those due to currency or commodity price changes.

-	Insurance Management:
•	Decide how best to limit a company’s losses by obtaining insurance against risks such as the need to make disability payments for an employee who gets hurt on the job and costs imposed by a lawsuit against the company.
-	Perform other duties as assigned
Job Requirement:
-	University degree in finance, accounting, economics, or business administration; Master Degree in Finance is a plus
-	At least 5 years prior supervisory experience of finance; experiences with Construction Company is preferred.
-	Must have Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) certification to investment professionals
-	Must have Analytical skills, Communication skills, Detail oriented, Math skills, and Organizational skills. 
-	Being able to work in team and good time management
-	Being honest, high commitment, good attitude, open-minded and work ethic.
-	Strong interpersonal, supervisory, Negotiation (mastered the art of persuasion), leadership, problem solving skills, and Ability Building Skill of team
-	Ability to multi-task, work under pressure and meet deadlines required.
-	Being highly responsible for work completion with accuracy and deadline;
-	Being able to travel to sites/provinces
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department  HR Manager 085638648 phv.recruit@gmail.com Phnom Penh Preah Monivong Blvd (93), Sangkat Phsar Doeum Thkov, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 085638648

Company Profile:
Since starting out in 1947, Jaspal Group has substantially diversified from import home linen distribution to a highly diversified textile driven conglomerate with interests in manufacturing, trading, retailing and real estate. The Group is known for a range of products from sophisticated to chic
ranging from men & ladies fashion, bags, fashion accessories to lifestyle home fashion and bedding
products for better living.

One of the most successful companies under Jaspal Group is Jaspal Company Limited, the top leading fashion retail company in Thailand engaging in designing, manufacturing, and marketing of several clothing and accessories brands. With over 2,350 professional staff and a network of 350
shops and corners all over Thailand, the Company has also proclaimed its reputation across Asian markets, as well as other major cities in the world.

Jaspal Group has stepped forward to expand its business to Cambodia under the name of Jaspal Fashions (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. and introduced four stores namely Jelly Bunny, Lyn, Lyn Around and CC-OO to AEON Mall, Phnom Penh. We are now ready to take a new challenge to introduce more stores to AEON Mall 2.

In this occasion, we are pleased to invite the qualified candidates who are passionate about fashion to join us and become a part of the greater success.

company_name: ក្រុមហ៊ុន ម៉េងលី ជេ. គួច អេឌ្យូខេសិន (Mengly J. Quach Education)
Job Description:
• Make sure the filing system is properly recorded and documents must be kept in both soft and hard copy
• Supervise and lead the archive team to produce the targeted results
• Coordinate and provide the necessary techniques or skills so that archive team can achieve targeted goal.
• Consults and report to HAO or ADCAO for technical matters or advices.
• Ensuring that all current document filing by appropriate labeling and coding
• Classify all the documents from Aii, AIS and MJQE to easily accessible when needed.
• Work closely with Administrative Department to ensure that timeline of annual archive documentation is reached.
• Random spot check all departments and feedback them on how to standardize their departmental document arrangement
• Combining yearly memo and announcement
• Finding documents when needed
• Newspaper management and ensure those newspapers are properly archived
• Help arrange school events arrangement when needed
• Make sure all properties in Archive Center is well taken care of, i.e. provide regular deep cleaning, no bad smell, and tidiness in the Archive Center.
• Filing spot check to make sure there is no damage to the files and document.
• Record all movement of properties and fixed-assets in Archive Center
• Assist Admin Team to arrange the necessary work for new term preparation
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor Degree in Management, Law or related fields.
• Administrative and organizational Skills
• Excellent in filing system and combining documents
• Be able to work in a team create the result-based environment
• Love working with documents.

*How to apply:

1. Submit your CV and Cover Letter with a 4x6 Current Photo to our email: hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh. Please be noted that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

2. Please always put your email subject as “Application for…………. (Position you applied)’’ and rename as your attached file in your full name, e.g., CV_Name.

Address: #11A, St. 402, Sangkat Tumnup Teuk, Khan Boeung Keng Kang, Phnom Penh,Cambodia.

Tel: (855) 12 797 939 (Mon-Fri, 7:30am to 6:00pm.)

Visit our website: www.mjqeducation.edu.kh
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Job Description:
- Supervising, managing, and leading to operate procurement process as professional input method.
- Developing and initiating procurement policy, procedures, guidelines, rules and regulations in order to implementing professional procurement efficiency and transparent practices.
- Designing strategies to response the company strategy plan and budgeting.
- Regularly check various vendors/suppliers to obtain quotations of goods for best values.
- Frequently dealing with suppliers to do price negotiation and discount.
- Review supplier evaluation form and issue purchase order.
- Regularly seeking for new appropriate suppliers and update to suppliers list.
- Networking with wholesale and reputed suppliers to company.
- Strong communication skills and daily working closely with procurement team, finance team, and requesters.
- Must be high responsible for deadline requisition bases.
- Review all expense report for subordinates.
- Ability to persuade vendor for creditable and cheque payment.
- Other tasks will be assigned by Line Manager"
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Job Description:
The Institut Pasteur du Cambodge (IPC) is a Cambodian non-for-profit research institution established in 1953,
IPC is today a scientific research establishment declared of public utility placed under the high patronage of the Ministry of Health of the Kingdom of Cambodia and under the responsibility of the Institute Pasteur on the scientific and technical levels. The IPC is a member of the Pasteur Network, which brings together 33 institutes present on five continents. It shares the Pasteurian values and the ethical charter to which the Pasteur Institutes are bound. The IPC has more than 250 employees, including about 30 expatriates of 10 nationalities and includes 5 research units. It carries out research activities
in health biology, public health and service activities (Medical Biology Laboratory, vaccinations and water and food
analyses) and training.
The lnstitut Pasteur du Cambodge (IPC) is recruiting a full-time Quality Assurance Coordinator in the ISO 15189
accredited Medical Biology Laboratory for a 12 months contract (renewable).

* Main responsibilities:

- The main responsibility is to assist the Head of the Medical Biology Laboratory in the implementation, maintenance and continuous improvement of the Quality Management System in accordance with international standard ISO 15189.
- Activities will include in particular, in collaboration with the Head of the laboratory: supervise the drafting of quality documents and their revision, facilitate quality meetings, manage the organization and management of internal quality audits, identify and analyze non-conformities, customer complaints and improvement actions.
Job Requirement:
- Diploma in the field of the laboratory or quality
- Other diploma :  engineer, pharmacist
- Language required: English and/or French in addition to Khmer
- Based in Phnom Penh
- Available to start as soon as possible

* Candidate Profile:

- Prior experience in a medical biology laboratory and/or in the quality/audit process is preferred but this job offer is also open to people without experience
- Good computer skills: word, excel, powerpoint and social networking
- Strong communication skills, written and verbal
- Good level language skills: English and/or French in addition to Khmer
- Proactive and dynamic working attitude

The complete application includes a cover letter – with salary expectations, copies of diplomas if any, work certificates, curriculum
vitae with a recent photo, Identity Card photocopy - all certified documents to the originals – are to be sent to the Human Resources department of Institut Pasteur du Cambodge #5, Monivong Blvd, Phnom Penh or by email to: recrutement@pasteur- kh.org, phone number: 092 777 665.

* Deadline: February 28 th , 2023.

The IPC is a member of the Pasteur Network, which brings together 33 institutes present on five continents. Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information RMA CAMBODIA  017888390 recruitment.kh@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 017888390

Job Description:
** Main Task: Conduct the procurement process, but not limited to:
- Comply with safety rules / Code of Conduct/Business Ethics as directed by the Group and Total Cambodge (TC)
- Responsible to ensure all requestors are complying to TC’s Purchasing Policy and Rules (i.e. any deviations are investigated/justified) and strictly adhere to the Anti-Corruption policy of TotalEnergies.
- Ensuring all necessary actions are taken not to be involved in any corruption, bribery and/or fraudulent activities.
- Quarterly, to monitor and ensure that Due Diligence reporting per Anti-Corruption policy is performed for the Purchasing department,
- Handle RFQ/Call for tender complying to TC's Purchasing Policy and Rules. (Project value <50 KUSD)
- Send the feedback to unsuccessful bidder by e-mail and clear filing/recording as proof of reference.
- Ensure that received quotation is in line with scope/specifications requested by requester, ensuring favorable TOC to TC and challenged when necessary to remove/revise terms/clauses that are detrimental to TC
- Receive and verify submitted PR to make sure that the specification/scope of work is clear, precise, completing with appropriate CAT Code, investment order code, cost center code and other critical info. as appropriate.
- Work closely with retail engineer, depot engineer team and other relevant key stakeholders to develop the scope of work/specifications for recurring purchases to launch call for tender and produce the yearly contract to efficiently reduce the number of RFQs.
- Review and/or create POs to be send to suppliers/vendors for Order Acceptance.
- Being in charge to source for new suppliers competitively and negotiate to obtain the maximum saving.
- Review open POs in SAP and ensure proper follow-ups monthly (should not have open POs 12months), ensuring timely and prompt delivery of G&S agreed/set in the agreement otherwise clear justification must be indicated for any delays.
- Liaise closely with key stakeholders in the event of delays by suppliers to ensure that there is no disruption in the Business operations, sourcing for alternatives to ensure continuation of operations if necessary.
- In charge of daily operational purchasing needs, prioritizing critical tasks to ensure no delays in projects. Handle all procurements related to MKT Dept., including the delegation purchase set forth in the purchasing policy,
- Build strong relationship with both suppliers and internal customers, foster team work to solve any issue in order to move fast the procurement process, yet minimize the compromising the purchasing policy/rules.
- Prepare the monthly savings report and record accurately the transactions in AGORA Tool monthly, maximizing savings per budget target
- Collaborate closely with Purchasing Executive to ensure smooth day-to-day purchasing operations and served as a back-up when needed.
- Annual review and housekeeping collaboration with Finance team of vendor MDM (i.e. blocked inactive vendors, review payment terms)

** Other task: to assist Purchasing Manager, not limited to:
- Conduct the Anti-Corruption Due Diligence for new awarding contract or/and for suppliers with annual amount over 50 KUSD following the Anti-Corruption Due Diligence Procedure.
- Conduct the presentation for refresh awareness session for concerned requesters annually and/or when required.
- Preparing the simple contract for spot purchase ensuring Fundamental Principles of Purchasing and Anti-Corruption clause are incorporated.
- Placing order through ARIBA for purchasing of club-card, solar panel, etc.
- Joining the ICC Audit for the main contractors initiated by HSE team and ICT Audit for transporters initiated by Transport team
- Joining the HR Audit to play role as a observer

** Accountabilities
- For the regular, improved performance of the Company’s purchasing activities and for ensuring that all purchasing activities are carried out according to the purchasing
policy/procedure and rules
- Direct any report to Purchasing Manager
- Adhere to all rules and regulation required for safety and anti-corruption which is a must
Job Requirement:
- Educational background: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or another related field
- Experience: working experience in the field of purchasing role is required
- Skill: High commitment and strong position in challenging/communication with people and self-study to enhance/expand general knowledge concerning the current carrier
- Knowledge: MS Office, Internet and Email proficiency
- Language: Good proficiency of English for both writing and speaking.

** Applications should be submitted via sm kh.hr@totalenergies.com or to our Head Office, ANINA Building 6th Floor, No 240, St. 271, B.P600, 12351 Phnom Penh, Cambodia
Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.
Company Profile:
TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. (previously called TOTAL Cambodge) is an affiliate of TotalEnergies, a broad energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people. 

TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been officially operating in Cambodia since 1993. Throughout the country, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. has been involved in marketing various energy and lubricants products and services to its customers in both the private and public sectors. We offer a wide range of products through more than 100 service stations with over 52 Bonjour Shops, Industrial fuels, Aviation fuels and lubricants. Through the TotalEnergies Card, customers are offered a convenient way to make and manage fuel purchases. Other services offered include used oil analysis, tank installations and bulk deliveries to many of our Commercial customers.

In view of supporting its growth in Cambodia, TotalEnergies Marketing (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.  is looking for a talented and motivated candidate for the position as follow:


Applications should be submitted via email: sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com *Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interview.
Contact Info: Contact Information Ms Lypy LY   sm-kh.hr@totalenergies.com ANINA Building 6th Floor, No 240, St 271, B.P 600,  Postal Code- 120606, Phnom Penh– CAMBODIA

Job Description:
- Position Title: Café Business Intern
- Reporting Line: Non-Fuel Manager – Café Business

** Key Responsibilities:
* Admin Work:
- To give supports on market research, marketing and product development.
- To follow up the sales commissions (with supports from sales team) and manage stocks (with supports from Manager/partners).
- To assist to Manager or/and coordinate with other departments to complete administrative document or request for legal document/ materials from partners/ suppliers.

- To manage and coordinate other reports on the monthly & quarterly basis.
- To prepare additional reports as required.

- Knowledge: Ability to use Microsoft office’s software
- Language: Good proficiency of English for both writing and speaking.
- Period of intern: 6 months up to 1 year with monthly allowance provided

Company Profile:
Cambodia Airports develops and manages Cambodia’s network of international airports located in Phnom Penh, Siem Reap, and Sihanoukville. Its teams plan and design the development of airport infrastructure, build and maintain the facilities, handle commercial activities and provides services to stakeholders, including The Royal Government of Cambodia, passengers, airlines, and tenants.

Company Profile:
Singapore (Cambodia) International Academy (SCIA) endeavours to be the centre of excellence in education and higher learning. SCIA is a member of the Singapore Institute of Management (SIM) Group, the leading provider of a diverse range of education pathways and professional training in Singapore. Recognising the importance of nurturing future leaders in Cambodia, SCIA offers the following programmes to cater to the different needs of learners:
- Early Childhood Education
- Primary Education
- Secondary Education
- Pre-University Education

With the expertise of trained Singapore and international educators, SCIA provides a holistic and rigorous education with a global perspective.

SCIA is a registered school of Cambridge Assessment International Education, and appointed by the Singapore Examinations and Assessment Board (SEAB) as an Overseas Examination Centre to conduct the Singapore International Primary School Examination (iPSLE). SCIA is also appointed by the University of London as the first and only Recognised Teaching Centre in Cambodia to offer the International Foundation Programme (IFP).

- by marketing and/or RO.

- Drive student recruitment sales by designing and implementing targeted marketing strategies
- Research on target customer segments and prospects to improve leads generation process

- Develop relevant processes and procedures to enhance team work flow that include smooth communication, transparency and sharing
- Establish partnerships with relevant organisations, including chambers of business councils and companies that can contribute to student enrolment of the school, through networking and outreach events.
Job Requirement:
1. Academic Education / Training / Experience

● Degree in Business, Marketing or Communications or related disciplines from an internationally recognised university
● Proficiency in English and Chinese language (spoken and written)
● Competent in Information Technology for use in data analysis, creating reports and presentations
● Has an eye for detail and willing to be hands-on in engaging customers and managing events.
● Strong sales experience on a service like education
● Meticulous, organised and able to work in a fast-paced start-up environment
● Creative and able to think out of the box
● Has good communication and problem-solving skills

● Some experience in Chamber work or business councils work is also a plus
● Have wide ranging network in key Khmer communities, including outreach plans on working and networking with Khmer VIPs/ excellencies/ trade and industry leaders

With the expertise of trained Singapore and international educators, SCIA provides a holistic and rigorous education with a global perspective.

SCIA is a registered school of Cambridge Assessment International Education, and appointed by the Singapore Examinations and Assessment Board (SEAB) as an Overseas Examination Centre to conduct the Singapore International Primary School Examination (iPSLE). SCIA is also appointed by the University of London as the first and only Recognised Teaching Centre in Cambodia to offer the International Foundation Programme (IFP).

Job Description: •	Managing whole or parts of the MEP works.•	Manage and verify and/or undertake setting out surveys for the works to be executed.•	checking technical design and construction drawings, together with contract specifications and other technical documents and contractual requirements to ensure that the requirements of the contract are strictly adhered to, and to highlight deviations where necessary for review and/or correction.•	Maintain a complete and current set of construction drawings, contract specifications and bill of quantities, addendum drawings, specialist drawings, or submissions, approved materials and products, site records and memoranda, instructions and directions, site reports, change requests and change logs, and other such records or documentation as required.•	carry out our day-to-day management of the site, including supervising and monitoring the site labour force and the work of any contractors, sub-contractors, specialist contractors and service providers.•	Spot and alert the management and MEP construction teams to any unsafe work or work methods and practices on site, ensuring that health and safety and sustainability, and environmental and pollution control laws are strictly adhered to on site.•	Conduct the mandated supervision and certification of works on site, testing and inspection records, maintaining a record and safe storage of reference samples, testing samples and records of inspection, site testing and certification records, and supervisions, records and certification of testing and commissioning of MEP systems (including photographic or videographic) records both in hardcopy and softcopy formats.•	Prepare site reports and other required administrative paperwork.•	Liaise with quantity surveyors for the ordering and pricing of materials.•	develop and uphold project timelines and milestones.•	Set clear goals and objectives, provide effective supervision, and manage performance of all contractors, subcontractors, specialist contractors and services providers to ensure efficient and safe construction operations as a whole on site.•	Ensuring the project produces the specified objectives and results in the annual goals and workplan(s) to the required standard of quality and within the prescribed timelines and budget parameters.•	Recommending changes to any part of the MEP works that is ongoing, or develop an alternate course of action if it appears that any part of the construction works is not proceeding on schedule, meeting its budget or is otherwise producing unsatisfactory results•	Reviewing consultant's and/or contractor's proposals by way of MEP designs, shop drawings, material, equipment, systems and system design selection, design, and specification proposals, together with architectural, engineering, interior, infrastructural, landscape and other design criteria, technical submissions, specifications and cost and quantities documents, and variations or change requests, and providing advice or recommendations to the Project Manager and/or Assistant Project Manager with regards to approving or rejecting them as necessary. •	Liaising with and building strong working relationships with industry partners.•	Devising cost-effective plans to enable effective project completion.•	Monitor and report on any possible project operational and compliance risks to avoid delays, statutory, legal or financial penalties or reputational damage.•	Working predominantly in a construction site environment, travelling where necessary to different field locations as required.
Job Requirement: •	Having bachelor’s degree in the electrical engineer or other related fields with 2 – 5 years’ experience in MEP field•	Capable and knowledgeable for both site management and MEP drawing •	Strong technical knowledge pertaining to construction and MEP engineering design criteria, construction sequencing and detailing, construction materials, methodologies, and best practices.•	Knowledge or familiarity with architectural and structural engineering design criteria, interior fit-out, landscape design criteria, associated construction sequencing and detailing, construction materials, methodologies and best practices is an advantage.•	Familiarity with the various testing and commissioning requirements of the pertinent MEP systems installed in the project is required.•	Good independent and critical thinking, and problem-solving skills.•	Be adaptable and possess a growth and agile mindset.•	Able to communicate effectively and is a good people manager•	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.•	The ability to foster a sense of team spirit within the Projects department, and also foster good, cohesive and collaborative working relationships with other departments within the organization.•	A reasonable level of fitness and mobility is required, as the work can be physically demanding. Site inspections may involve climbing ladders or visiting areas of sites where access is difficult. Appropriate safety equipment, such as protective boots and headgear, must be worn on site.

Job Description: Job descriptionWe’re a world-leading smart mobility tech company with over 1,500,000 subscribers across 23 countries, and we’re looking for an experienced Automotive Technician / Mechanic with a proven track record to install and maintain IoT / GPS products according to prescribed fitment techniques and quality standards.RESPONSIBILITY:● Install and maintain IoT / GPS devices according to technical procedures.● Manage and maintain allocated resources which includes vehicle, tools, stock, etc.● As the role is client facing, ensure timely, attentive and upbeat service to the customer in such a manner that it reflects positively on the company.Description/ការពិពណ៌នាខាត្រិក(CARTRACK)ជាក្រុមហ៊ុនឈានមុខគេនៅលើវិស័យបច្ចេកវីទ្យាចល័តដ៏វៃឆ្លាត(Smart Mobility Technology) ដែលមានអតិថិជនចំនួន ១,៥០០,០០០ នៅទូទាំង ២៣ ប្រទេស ។ បច្ចុប្បន្នពួកយើងកំពុងស្វែងរកបុគ្គលិកផ្នែកបច្ចេកទេសដែលមានចំនាញ និងបទពិសោធន៍ក្នុងការដំឡើងឧបករណ៍តាមដានដែលបំពាក់នៅលើឡានប្រកបដោយគុណភាពការដំឡើងទៅតាមស្តង់ដារបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុនបានកំណត់។Responsibility/ទំនូលខុសត្រូវការងារ-	ដំឡើង និងត្រួតពិនិត្យឧបករណ៍ទៅតាមស្តង់ដារបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុន-	គ្រប់គ្រង និងត្រួតពិនិត្យសំភារៈផ្សេងៗរួមជាមួយឧបករណ៍ជាងព្រមទាំងរថយន្តរបស់ក្រុមហ៊ុនផងដែរ-	ត្រូវយកចិត្តទុកដាក់ចំពោះអតិថិជន នៅពេលដែលអតិថិជនមានបញ្ហា ត្រូវដោះស្រាយជូនអតិថិជនអោយទាន់ពេលវេលាជាមួយសេវាកម្មល្អ និងប្រកបដោយអាកប្បកិរិយាសមរម្យដែលជួយអោយក្រុមហ៊ុនមានកេរ្តិ៍ឈ្មោះកាន់តែល្អប្រសើរ
Job Requirement: REQUIREMENTS:● Applicable Electronic or Electrical Equipment Certificate (advantageous but not required)● Minimum experience installing electronic equipment into vehicles● Valid Driver’s License● Excellent Time Management● Conflict Management● Strong Communication Skills● Attention to DetailRequirement/តំរូវការ-	មានចំនេះដឹងផ្នែកអេឡិចត្រូនិច និងប្រព័ន្ធភ្លើងរថយន្ត (អតិ្ថភាពសំរាប់អ្នកមានសញ្ញាបត្រ)-	មានបទពិសោធន៍ខ្លះៗក្នុងដំឡើងឧបករណ៍ដូចជា ម៉ាញេ អេក្រង់ឡាន ។ល។-	មានប័ណ្ណបើកបរ-	មានសមត្ថភាពល្អក្នុងការបែងចែកពេលវេលា-	មានលិទ្ធភាពបែងចែកគ្រប់គ្រង់ល្អ-	មានទេពកោសល្យក្នុងការទំនាក់ទំនងល្អជាមួយអតិថិជន-	យកចិត្តទុកដាក់ និងលំអិតនៅរាល់បញ្ហាកើតឡើងចំពោះអតិថិជន

Job Description: Key Responsibilities· Responsible for constantly reviewing, researching, updating and rolling-out customer experience and SOP· Participant in store design and advocate for the use of technology within stores· Work across with sales team, operation team, and customer experience team to improve on customer satisfaction and customer journey· Identify ways to reflect Cellcard's brand image and brand tagline· Keep on track of customer journey progress and how the SOPs are implemented· Performs other tasks as assigned by management.
Job Requirement: Job Requirements· Degree in Business Management or related fields· At least 5 years’ experience in customer experience· Experience in writing SOP, change management, and customer journey design process· Attention to detail and result oriented.· Critical thinking and problem solving· English proficiency· Dynamic, innovative, and able to work independently.
Company Profile:
As Cambodia’s longest-serving and only 100% locally owned mobile communications company, Cellcard has more than 24 years of service to the Kingdom maintaining a customer base of more than 4 million subscribers.

Cellcard launched in 1997 in a joint venture with Millicom International Cellular providing its customers with the first prepaid service with scratchcards.

What followed for Cellcard was a number of firsts in the market such as introducing SMS, Value-Added Services, a dedicated Loyalty program, roaming services and a credit sharing platform.

Cellcard is Cambodia’s most-awarded mobile network having achieved more than 30 industry awards for network excellence including an impressive six consecutive Ookla Speedtest awards and a number of category wins from Opensignal including Best Games Experience in February 2020.

It’s most recent market firsts include the Cellcard Network Guarantee launched in 2017 reimbursing any customer who experiences a dropped call, the award-winning App-based Super Data Race held each year since 2017 and its move to lead the esports agenda in 2018 followed in 2019 with Cambodia’s first virtual gamer platform PlayGame and the first tailormade gamer data plan PlayGame Unlimited.

In February 2021, Cellcard revealed its latest innovation, the Pouk Mak chat app, the world’s first major Khmer languaged messaging App.

A major focus for Cellcard now is its evolution to 5G for consumers and enterprise, including Smart City applications across Fintech and web security, data privacy, public safety and security, environment protection, education, healthcare and e-government.

In terms of 5G network readiness, Cellcard has conducted numerous live tests on its stand-alone site reaching speeds of 1.8 gigabytes per second. These are Cambodia’s first and only tests conducted on a real end-to-end with 5G radio to a 5G core network able to accommodate network slicing for dedicated use cases.

Job Description: Key Responsibilities· Reviews requirements with Subject Matter Expert· Creates and manages test plans and test cases for the testing as well as for the UAT testing with stakeholders· Designs, develops, and executes automation scripts, and performs automation testing· Controls and manages daily test activities· Assists developers in creating detailed application test plans· Performs testing on the project such as functional testing, load testing, exploratory testing, etc.· Analyses the software performance against the designer's intention· Leads and ensures quality and readiness for every product· Assists in setting up and maintaining a test lab· Perform continuous improvement on the Quality Assurance processes and tools within the department· Provides reports to management as required· Performs other tasks as assigned by management
Job Requirement: Job Requirements· Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related fields· At least 2 years experience in creating test scripts or related methodologies· Experienced in working on Agile or Scrum development framework· Ability to understand project specifications and user psychology· Ability to analyze complex applications and systems with minimal supervision· Knowledge in understanding Java, Python, SQL, C++, XML, or other related· English proficiency· Computer literacy· Be flexible, dynamic, and able to work independently

As Cambodia’s longest-serving and only 100% locally owned mobile communications company, Cellcard has more than 24 years of service to the Kingdom maintaining a customer base of more than 4 million subscribers.

Cellcard launched in 1997 in a joint venture with Millicom International Cellular providing its customers with the first prepaid service with scratchcards.

What followed for Cellcard was a number of firsts in the market such as introducing SMS, Value-Added Services, a dedicated Loyalty program, roaming services and a credit sharing platform.

Cellcard is Cambodia’s most-awarded mobile network having achieved more than 30 industry awards for network excellence including an impressive six consecutive Ookla Speedtest awards and a number of category wins from Opensignal including Best Games Experience in February 2020.

It’s most recent market firsts include the Cellcard Network Guarantee launched in 2017 reimbursing any customer who experiences a dropped call, the award-winning App-based Super Data Race held each year since 2017 and its move to lead the esports agenda in 2018 followed in 2019 with Cambodia’s first virtual gamer platform PlayGame and the first tailormade gamer data plan PlayGame Unlimited.

In February 2021, Cellcard revealed its latest innovation, the Pouk Mak chat app, the world’s first major Khmer languaged messaging App.

A major focus for Cellcard now is its evolution to 5G for consumers and enterprise, including Smart City applications across Fintech and web security, data privacy, public safety and security, environment protection, education, healthcare and e-government.

In terms of 5G network readiness, Cellcard has conducted numerous live tests on its stand-alone site reaching speeds of 1.8 gigabytes per second. These are Cambodia’s first and only tests conducted on a real end-to-end with 5G radio to a 5G core network able to accommodate network slicing for dedicated use cases.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.
Contact Info: Contact Information Tek Hangnisa (Ms.)  092 888 530/010 804 883 efgcareer@rmagroup.net #27, St. 134, SangkatMittapheap, Khan 7 Makara, Phnom Penh 092 888 530/010 804 883

company_name: Sinh Hak Hout Trading Co., Ltd
Job Description:
	Preparation of the companies’ manpower plan and payroll budget, ensure that all Line Manager are informed, assist with forecasting procedure to ensure that payroll is kept in line with budget. 
	Conduct periodic TM survey as per the plans from the Head Office and the results are published on time. 
	Assist Line Managers to formulate proper action plans to address areas of concern. 
	Arrange monthly Team Member meetings - TM Committee Meeting.
	Monthly award ceremony - to ensure that such meetings take place to develop a culture of strong communication in line with companies’ credo.
	Identify issues related to TM, propose suggestion to top management, and implement action plans. 
	Conduct periodic competition surveys related to salary structure, TM benefits and facilities and propose recommendations to the management. 
	Ensure that remuneration packages are competitive and in line with the statutes prevailing in the country. 
	Ensure that the company's TM procedures are strictly adhered to. 
	Ensure that TM files are properly maintained and kept under safe custody. 
	Ensure that Job Descriptions are up-to-date and accurately describe each position and that the recruitment and selection of people is done objectively and based on Job Descriptions and Specifications.  
	Ensure timely and cost-effective recruitment through the use of the appropriate source. 
	Ensure that new or transferred TM have an effective induction program as per the policy of the SHH.
	As a member of the Executive Committee, participate and contribute in the development and preparation of the Companies’ Strategic plan and Business plan.
	Analyze labor turnover statistics so that problem areas are highlighted and the appropriate action taken. 
	Coordinate with Finance department to ensure that various bonuses/incentive are distributed on time.  
	Champion the performance management system of the company - from monthly monitoring of department goal tracker to finalization and distribution of the bonus or retention bonus.
	Ensure that line managers are fully aware of and responding to all statutory legislation affecting the catering industry. 
	Demonstrate a working knowledge of crisis management and fire prevention and to ensure that TM follow the company evacuation procedures when required. 
	Ensure that all TM accommodation is well-managed and maintained (for those who provided the accommodation).
	Ensure that the company's objective for labor turnover is maintained or improved.
	Ensure that managers are trained and have the ability to conduct effective interviews. 
	Ensure that the company's succession plan is done in meaningful and effective way and that the individual career development plans (ICDPs) agreed at the appraisals are followed up and adhered to.
	Ensure that meaningful appraisals for all TM are carried out on a regular basis.
	Champion the social and environmental activities of the company in coordination with the Top Management & Manager. 
	Identify and propose social responsibility activities to be carried out for the financial year. 
	Coordinate with the identified organizations and carry out all social responsibility activities that has been planned.
Job Requirement:
	6-8 years’ minimum experience of working in HR, ideally with experience of a Company &/or resort with mature HR processes and practices. Proven working knowledge across all aspects of HR including recruitment, training and development, employee engagement and retention, employee relations and reward management. Related working experience in transforming new culture in the organization 
	Proven extensive experience managing the full range of HR services in a fast-moving business. Possessing (or working towards) professional certification in HR is expected 
	Strong emotional intelligence coupled with the ability to constructively challenge and hold others to a high standard in all areas of people management they have responsibility for 
	Excellent interpersonal skills hence essential and the ability and judgement to management sensitive situations. Proven ability to bring others along with own approach and thinking, so leading and influencing with knowledge but also passion is important 
	Working knowledge of national employment laws and practices 
	Active affiliation in HR networks and organizations to understand 
	the HR environment 
	Project management skills, a drive to understand the business and link HR plans to business outcomes 
	Comfortable with data and have proven experience of using it to drive the HR discussion with leadership 
	Experience of working internationally/across other cultures desirable 
	Passion for the company purpose, vision and mission 
	Actively seeks to develop self and own team, with a curiosity and growth mindset, continually open to opportunities to improve and learn 
	Ability to work independently and take initiative on key tasks 
	Ability to managing multiple priorities, be able to work with detail and see the bigger picture and be proactive and highly organized. Comfortable with ambiguity 
	Have a strong belief in fairness, confidentiality and be comfortable holding others to account to preserve and advance the compa

Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

1- HLH Agriculture (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
2- HLHI (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
3- Royal Hong Lai Haut One Company Limited.
4- Jewel A Development Co., Ltd.
5- Agri-Oral Joint Cooperate Co., Ltd.
6- Public Housing Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
7- PH One Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.

position: ប្រធានផ្នែកបណ្តុះបណ្តាលសហគមន៍ (Community Training Manager)
Job Description:
• ត្រូវធ្វើដំណើរ និង ចុះបំពេញការងារជាប្រចាំនៅតាមបណ្តាខេត្តនៃតំបន់ភូមិភាគឥសាន 
• រៀបចំផែនការបណ្តុះបណ្តាលអំពីការប្រើប្រាស់ចង្ក្រានប្រសិទ្ធិភាពនៅតាមតំបន់គោលដៅ
• រៀបចំ និង ចងក្រងបញ្ជីរឈ្មោះ និង លេខទំនាក់ទំនង របស់ អាជ្ញាធរមូលដ្ឋាន និង សមាគមន៍ជនជាតិដើមភាគតិច
• ចុះជួប និងស្នើសុំកិច្ចសហការពីសំណាក់អាជ្ញាធរមូលដ្ឋាន ពីសំណាក់ មេឃុំ មេភូមិ និង/ឬ ព្រមទាំងបណ្តាញនានា
• គ្រប់គ្រង ដឹកនាំ និង សម្របសម្រួល ការបណ្តុះបណ្តាលអំពីការប្រើប្រាស់ចង្ក្រានប្រសិទ្ធិនៅតាមបណ្តាសហគមន៍នៃតំបន់គោលដៅ
• រៀបចំរបាយការណ៍បេសសកម្មលម្អិត ប្រចាំសប្តាហ៍ និង/ឬ ប្រចាំខែ
• រៀបចំរបាយការណ៍វឌ្ឍនភាព ប្រចាំត្រីមាស និង របាយការណ៍បូកសរុបប្រចាំឆ្នាំ
• គ្រប់គ្រង និង វាយតម្លៃសមិទ្ធកម្មការងាររបស់បុគ្គលិកដែលស្ថិតនៅក្រោមឱវាទ
• ការងារដទៃផ្សេងទៀតអាស្រ័យទៅតាមការចាត់ចែងរបស់ថ្នាក់ដឹកនាំ
Job Requirement:
• បញ្ចប់បរិញ្ញាប័ត្រ (Bachelor Degree) ផ្នែក អប់រំ កសិកម្ម បរិស្ថាន ឬ ការអភិវឌ្ឍន៍សហគមន៍
• មានបទពិសោធន៍ការងារអភិវឌ្ឍន៍សហគមន៍ (Community Field Works) យ៉ាងតិចចំនួន០៣ឆ្នាំ
• មានបទពិសោធន៍គ្រប់គ្រងការបណ្តុះបណ្តាល ឬ ការរៀបចំកម្មវិធីអប់រំផ្សេងៗ (Training or Educational Program Management)

- ការងារដទៃផ្សេងទៀតអាស្រ័យទៅតាមការចាត់ចែងរបស់ថ្នាក់ដឹកនាំ

- មានម៉ូតូផ្ទាល់ខ្លួន

** អត្ថប្រយោជន៍ និង ព័ត៌មានផ្សេងៗ៖

Job Description: - research about potential clients - attend events to find clients - make contracts with clients - visit potential clients - follow up with clients - Place calls or arrange meetings with potential clients to identify their requirements and needs - Prepare and present sales proposals to prospective clients. - Ensure physical involvement in operation of route when staff shortages arise - Coordinate and implement sales targets set by management and prepare sales plan - Ensure proper implementation of sales campaigns / promotional activities - Conduct regular meetings with sale team for feedback on status of sales - Measure and evaluate the performance of the sales force - Monitor daily activities of salesman and follow up on sales progress & accomplishments
Job Requirement: - Graduate bachelor preferred with Sale and Marketing qualification- Minimum 2 years work experience in sale and marketing with Real Estate or Serviced Apartment- Proficiency in MS Office and accounting software- Good personality, honesty and professional  - Attention to Detail, Deadline-Oriented, and confidentiality.- Professional knowledge of sale and marketing- Be professional in communication skill- Good in English Communication is a must and Chinese is Plus Advantage- Ability to handle the guest complaint in very good manner and professionally
Company Profile:
Hong Lai Huat Group Limited (HLH Group) is a well-established and reputable real estate and property developer with 30 years of successful track record. Established since 1998, the Group has completed numerous projects in Singapore ranging from public and private resident developments, to commercial and industrial building. Some of its notable developments include D’Ecosia, D’s Fresco, D’s Castilia, D’Almira, D’ Lithium, D’Kranji Farm Resort and D’Centenial.

In 2008, the Group diversified into the agriculture sector in Cambodia and had since completed the development of a 10,000 hectares farmland that cultivates cassava, as well as invested in a cassava starch production factory.

The Group also expanded into property development in Cambodia with the development of its first freehold mixed-used project- D’ Seaview, in Sihanouk Ville. One of the largest mixed-use developments in Sihanouk Ville, D’Seaview comprises 737 residential units and 64 commercial units. HLH Group was listed on the Mainboard of the Singapore Exchange on 21st June 2000.

4- Jewel A Development Co., Ltd.
5- Agri-Oral Joint Cooperate Co., Ltd.
6- Public Housing Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.
7- PH One Development (Cambodia) Co., Ltd.

job title: Sales Associate (JASPAL, CCOO, CHAMPION, LYN, JELLY BUNNY, ASICS, FRED PERRY)
position: Sales Associate (JASPAL, CCOO, CHAMPION, LYN, JELLY BUNNY, ASICS, FRED PERRY)
Job Description:
The Sales Associate is responsible for providing warm welcome, effective presentation and demonstration of products and with a high level of service to customers in order to satisfy their shopping needs and enhance their shopping experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Achieve sales target as assigned by the Company
• Follow the company guideline and operational standard
• Replenish products on shelf and participate in stock count
• Maintain good housekeeping conditions in the store
• Maintain well-presented visual merchandise and displays
• Provide excellent customer service and product knowledge to customers
• Assist in opening and closing of the store
• Assist in cashiering duties when required
• Assist and support in-store marketing events
Job Requirement:
REQUIREMENT
• Min. high school degree or higher in any field
• At least 1 year experience in fashion retail or service industry
• Pleasant, neat, warm and friendly personality
• Service-oriented with strong selling and customer service skills
• Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
• Confident, honest, enthusiastic and a good team player
• Responsible, patient and motivated with positive work attitude
• Computer literate is an added advantage
• Good in spoken English to liaise with the superiors and serve international customers
• Commit to work on shift, long hours, weekends, and Public Holidays as needed
• Able to work at CHIP MONG 271 MEGA MALL

APPLICATION INFORMATION:
We offer a competitive remuneration package to the right candidate. Interested applicants, please submit your application with a complete resume detailing experience, qualifications, present and expected salary, phone number and email address to kh-hr@jpsfashions.com or contact 012 784 316. 

Only shortlist candidates will be contacted.
Company Profile:
Since starting out in 1947, Jaspal Group has substantially diversified from import home linen distribution to a highly diversified textile driven conglomerate with interests in manufacturing, trading, retailing and real estate. The Group is known for a range of products from sophisticated to chic
ranging from men & ladies fashion, bags, fashion accessories to lifestyle home fashion and bedding
products for better living.

One of the most successful companies under Jaspal Group is Jaspal Company Limited, the top leading fashion retail company in Thailand engaging in designing, manufacturing, and marketing of several clothing and accessories brands. With over 2,350 professional staff and a network of 350
shops and corners all over Thailand, the Company has also proclaimed its reputation across Asian markets, as well as other major cities in the world.

Jaspal Group has stepped forward to expand its business to Cambodia under the name of Jaspal Fashions (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. and introduced four stores namely Jelly Bunny, Lyn, Lyn Around and CC-OO to AEON Mall, Phnom Penh. We are now ready to take a new challenge to introduce more stores to AEON Mall 2.

In this occasion, we are pleased to invite the qualified candidates who are passionate about fashion to join us and become a part of the greater success.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mr. Chin Panha  N/A kh-hr@jpsfashions.com Chip Mong 271 Mega Mall, Aeon Mall Phnom Penh, Aeon Mall Sen Sok City and Aeon Mall Mean Chey N/A

job title: Store Supervisor (Jelly Bunny-Chip Mong 271 Mega Mall)
position: Store Supervisor (Jelly Bunny-Chip Mong 271 Mega Mall)
Job Description:
PEOPLE MANAGEMENT
• To organise and distribute tasks and positions to each member of the team.
• To communicate actively with the team, according to requirements.
• To ensure a good level of customer service in the team.
• To participate in the recruitment of store personnel and learn to do it on your own.
• To actively collaborate in the correct integration of all new employees
• To detect the potential of each employee and mentor them in their development.
• To support with the effective management of personnel administration duties.
• To monitor and ensure the correct personal and professional image of the team.
• Wherever necessary, to manage potential conflict in the correct manner.
• To ensure compliance with the regulations and the legislation.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT
• To actively participate in planning the required measures in order to meet targets.
• To analyse management indicators and costs in order to improve them.
• To continuously monitor sales and customer service.
• During busy periods, to dedicate time to direct selling alongside the team.
• To supervise and apply administrative procedures according to the internal regulations.
• To apply all instructions received (HQ, supervisor, etc.) and report on them (if necessary).
• To carry out strict supervision of the entire cash desk procedure.
• To participate in the optimisation of internal resources and try to minimise expenses e.g.
optimisation of the workforce, suppliers, etc.
• To communicate and pass on any information that may affect sales.

PRODUCT AND MERCHANDISING
• To be familiar with the collection and maximise sales (initial order, entries, etc.).
• To participate in the implementation of Merchandising standards.
• To know the profitability of the store and furniture displays in order to maximise sales.
• To be familiar with and apply the replenishing standards of the store.
• To respect and monitor compliance with merchandising and furniture display guidelines.
• To produce stylings, silhouettes and combinations on a regular basis.
• To control and manage stock (both in transit and in the stockroom) and inventories.
• To ensure the correct end of season return (inventories).
• To ensure compliance with the store image, maintenance and window dressing standards.
• To provide product feedback (his/hers and customers’).
Job Requirement:
• Basic knowledge of the business indicators.
• Customer Service Standard and Service Policy.

Company Profile:
Since starting out in 1947, Jaspal Group has substantially diversified from import home linen distribution to a highly diversified textile driven conglomerate with interests in manufacturing, trading, retailing and real estate. The Group is known for a range of products from sophisticated to chic
ranging from men & ladies fashion, bags, fashion accessories to lifestyle home fashion and bedding
products for better living.

One of the most successful companies under Jaspal Group is Jaspal Company Limited, the top leading fashion retail company in Thailand engaging in designing, manufacturing, and marketing of several clothing and accessories brands. With over 2,350 professional staff and a network of 350
shops and corners all over Thailand, the Company has also proclaimed its reputation across Asian markets, as well as other major cities in the world.

Jaspal Group has stepped forward to expand its business to Cambodia under the name of Jaspal Fashions (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. and introduced four stores namely Jelly Bunny, Lyn, Lyn Around and CC-OO to AEON Mall, Phnom Penh. We are now ready to take a new challenge to introduce more stores to AEON Mall 2.

In this occasion, we are pleased to invite the qualified candidates who are passionate about fashion to join us and become a part of the greater success.
